loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional items in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two daughters and three sons, who are all out of school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en: Peter is 58 years old married with three children. He grows vegetables and supplies milk to clients who come from within the Kiambaa location. He also sells his vegetables in Nairobi city. He earns a monthly profit of approximately kshs 29,000. Peter has never borrowed from another micro-finance institution. This will be his third loan from KADET and he will use it to buy a water pump so that his vegetables get enough water for growth. Peter hopes to own a big dairy farm and to buy more land to produce more vegetables for his supply. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy an electic water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Mafi Ah

texts.en:
Mafi Ah C. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Aele.  She is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Mafi owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Mafi has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mafi is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Mafi is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Mafi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to make improvements to the borrower's house.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora T. is 51 years old. She lives with her husband, Edgar, in their village of Larion Bajo Tuguegarao, City. Edgar, age 52, manufactures simple knives. They are blessed with two adult children who are both single.

Teodora and her husband work hard and help each other to provide for the needs of their family. They patiently operate a blacksmithing and manufacturing business in their village. She goes from house to house and from agency to another to sell their finished products. Teodora earns PHP 500 in daily income that she uses for their basic daily needs.

Teodora has been in this business since 2000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5, 000 from Kiva lenders to improve their blacksmithing and manufacturing business.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her manufacturing business

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Sros Y., 37, is married with four school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children.

Mrs. Y. is engaged in the business of selling chickens and vegetables at a nearby local market in the town and raising pigs at her home, earning approximately US$17 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband who helps his wife at the market and with raising pigs at home.

Mrs. Y. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Y. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to buy a motorbike with compartment attached to easily transport chickens to sell. With the remainder, she wants to invest in her pig-raising business. She hopes that her new business of selling chickens will enable her family to generate extra income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting her chickens

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn T. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Edelyn is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Edelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling daily products such as shampoo, sardines, biscuits, candies and sugar in the local community. Edelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Edelyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying aluminum

loans.name: Barbara Maria

texts.es:
Bárbara López de 37 años de edad, vive en una casa de cemento tienen la facilidad de contar con los servicios de agua, alcantarillado, luz y caminos pavimentados ya que por los sectores que vive es muy raro que tenga estos beneficios su casa esta ubicada en el sector de la Perimetral de Guayaquil.

Bárbara comenzó vendiendo ropa y perfumes con esto ella aportaba a los gastos familiares pero a raíz que murió su esposo  Bárbara se convirtió en el primer ingreso del hogar y decidió poner un Soda-Bar en la que vende batidos a $ 0.60 c/u y tostadas a $ 0.35 c/u esos ingresos le ayudan para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos uno de 18 años y una niña de  9 años que con esfuerzo están en una escuela particular, aunque unas de sus mayores dificultades son las lluvias sigue adelante por sus 2 hijos.

Con el préstamo quiere mejorar su vivienda comprando cemento, adoquines, piezas para el baño en el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para alquilarla y tener otro ingreso adicional, además de eso quiere que su negocio sea muy conocido por su sector.
texts.en:
Bárbara López is 37 years of age, and lives in a cement house that has water, a sewer systems, light, and paved walkways. It is very rare in the sector where she lives to have these benefits. Her house is located in the sector of la Perimetral de Guayaquil. Bárbara commenced selling clothes and perfume, and with this contributed to the household costs. However her husband then died, and Bárbara then became the primary earner of her home and decided to open a Soda Bar where she sells milkshakes for $.60 each and toast for $0.35 each. These earnings help her to maintain her 2 children, one who is 18 and a little girl who is 9, who with Bárbara's effort is in a private school. Although one of her biggest difficulties is rain, she continues forward for her children. With the loan she wants to improve her house, buying cement, paving stones, and parts for the bathroom. In the future she wants to buy a truck that she can rent out for additional income, and also wants her business to be very well known by her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, paving stones, parts for the bathroom

loans.name: Cruzpata Group

texts.es:
Nuestras socias, pertenecen al banco comunal “CRUZPATA” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Las socias se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 17 socias. En el video se ve que están en una D. las reuniones que ellas tienen. La asesora Carmen les esta indicando las fechas D. pago del préstamo y las socias están tomando nota. Nuestras socias son puntuales en la asistencia D. todas las reuniones que se acuerdan, pues si una socia llega tarD. paga una multa e igual si se falta a la reunión.         

Nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta D. productos D. belleza, ropa, cueros para zapato, comestibles, verduras, comida, carne, productos D. plastiqueria y D. animales menores, Otras socias se dedican a brindar servicios D. contabilidad y costura. 
     
La socia Milder Silvia tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene un hijo. La socia se dedica a pintar cuadros cusqueños. La socia dibuja los paisajes D. la sierra del Cusco y a campesinos en sus chacras. Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales D. pintura. 

Las socias requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como comestibles, verduras, telas, ropa y mucho más,  así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(En el video a parecen algunas amigas D. las socias).
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Cruzpata Communal Bank. They live in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department. The members meet every 30 days in the central office of the Arariwa Association. There are 17 members. In the video you can see them in one of their meetings. The treasurer, Carmen, is showing the dates to make loan payments, and the members are taking notes. Our members are punctual in attending all of the agreed upon meetings. If a member arrives late, she pays a fine. The same is true if a meeting is missed. Our members alternate their activities between their diverse household chores and selling things like beauty products, clothes, shoe leather, food, vegetables, meals, meat, plastic goods, and small animals. Other members offer services like accounting and sewing. One member, Milder Silvia, is 27. She is married, and has one child. She paints pictures of Cusco. She draws the mountain scenery of Cusco and the country people on their farms. She has been doing this for eight years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her business. She needs a loan to buy more materials for painting. The members need a loan to buy more products like food, vegetables, fabric, clothes, and much more. Then they can increase their business capital, get greater earnings, and give their children a better quality of life. The members value and are grateful for the loan from this medium. They promise to make their payments on time. (Some friends of the members appear in the video.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur VILMA FRANCISCA from  Peru

loans.use: Buy more products like food, vegetables, fabric, clothes, and much more

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old married mother of seven children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a mining community. Mary works to support her husband financially to be able to take proper care of the family. Her children are all in school. 

She is a petty trader. She sells on a tabletop in the market square. Mary buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and food items

loans.name: Marissa's Group

texts.en:
Marissa V. is from the village of Tueg Bitag Grande, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 30 years old. Marissa is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI/Kiva. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marissa is married and has 3 young children. Marissa owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and for resale. Marissa has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Marissa is requesting a new loan, her second, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Sr. Ruben, vive en la localidad de El Torno, es soltero y estudia una carrera tecnica y en sus tiempos libres trabaja, su actividad principal es el servicio de transporte de personas con su vehiculo automotor, tiene muchas ganas de superación por lo que desde su corta edad trabaja para salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus padres que son de edad avanzada, el es el unico que se encarga de mantener el hogar, es responsable y trabajador, el destino del credito es para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y comprar llantas. Uno de sus deseos es el de poder terminar su carrera y pronto formar una familia.

El Sr. Ruben esta agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Ruben lives in El Torno, he is single and is studying for his technical degree and in his free time he works transporting people in his automobile. He has a lot of aspirations to excel in life and even though he is young, he wants to succeed and be able to help his parents who are elderly; he is the only one in charge of supporting the home. He is responsible and hardworking; the loan will be used as maintenance for his vehicle and to buy tires. One of his wishes is to be able to finish his degree and soon have a family.

Mr. Ruben is very grateful to emprender (Kivas’s field partner) and Kiva for the trust given to him and for the loan granted.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of a vehicle.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 56 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Hilda de 56 años y lo que más desean es tener una vejez tranquila.

Cuando era niño sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la agricultura y a medida que pasaba el tiempo se fue haciendo cargo de esas tierras, ya que sus hermanos mayores decidieron dedicarse a otras actividades. Ahora tiene extensas chacras, de las cuales cosecha maíz y papa, para luego venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia. Lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de las plagas. Desea con muchas fuerzas, lograr comprarse un carro con el cual pueda transportar sus productos.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Gregorio con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeros. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se está vendiendo.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 56 years old. He is a happy and simple father who lives in his own home with his wife Hilda (age 56). What they desire most is to have a peaceful retirement.

As a child, his parents showed him everything he needed to know about farming. As time passed, Gregorio was put in charge of looking after his family’s land since his older brothers decided to pursue other activities. He now has extensive farms in which he grows corn and potatoes that he later sells at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What he enjoys most about his job is cultivating the land since this provides food for his family. Gregorio has been in this line of work for 45 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting his crops from pestilence. After much hard work, he was able to buy a car so that he could transport his products.

This is Gregorio’s eighth loan with MFP. He has also been punctual with his loan payments and hopes to continue in the same manner. In his Communal Bank, he is very supportive of the other members. With this loan of 2000 PEN, he will buy seeds for planting peas since this crop currently sells the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Mrs. Nhong Nheong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nhong N. is the elected leader of a sixteen-person loan group in Preaek Ta In village in Kandal province. She breeds fish and her husband is a construction worker and farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to feed his family. Since her business is goI. well, she wants to expand and so is askI. for a loan to buy fish food to breed more fish. The couple has three children — one a fish seller, and the others still in school.

loans.use: To buy fish food to breed fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To stock more cattle to match his customers' high demand

loans.name: Mura

texts.en:
Mura N. sells used clothes and sandals at the market. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell. Mura is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has 2 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to continue to be able to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Ludis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ludis Antonio G. V., tiene la edad de 30 años vive con su compañera de vida y sus 5 hijos menores de edad en Lomas de Gavilan en Ticuantepe, sus hijos  se dedican a los estudios, y la familia  labora en los cultivos de la yuca desde hace ya más de 20 años.

Dentro de los planes a futuro está la edificación de su vivienda, que por problemas de fluidez monetaria no han podido  llevar a cabo, ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, materiales agrícolas, fertilizantes y fungicidas, que permitan un mejor mantenimiento de las tierras para una mejor cosecha, esto les favorecerá a futuro el capital necesario para nuevos proyecto, incluidos claro está la edificación de su hogar. Esta inversion farvoreceria a gran escala los niveles de vida de la familia, sobre todo a los menores ya que les permitiria mejores condiciones y la satisfaccion de los padres de poder ofrecerles un futuro ams prospero.
texts.en:
Ludis Antonio G. V., 30, lives with his life partner and their 5 minor children in Lomas de Gavilan, Ticuantepe. His children are all students and the family has farmed manioc for over 20 years now. His future plans include building his house but cash flow problems have kept him from reaching this goal. They are asking for funds to buy farm supplies that will allow for better care of their farmlands so that crop yields will be better. This will be favorable for them because it will produce capital to be used in future projects, including building their house. This investment will greatly improve the family’s standard of living, especially for the youngsters because living conditions will be better and to the great satisfaction of the parents for being able to provide a more prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fungicides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Colette est mariée à AYABA Ludovic, un maçon. Le couple a six enfants à charge, dont cinq sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a près de dix ans que Colette habite le quartier Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Colette n’a pas été à l’école. Pour se prendre en charge, et venir en aide à son mari, Colette vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Colette vend de l’huile d’arachide et de la farine de manioc. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Colette se ravitaille. Colette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu six crédits qui ont été bien remboursés.  La clientèle de Colette s’accroît de plus en plus, et elle n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. C’est dont pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et pour faire face à la demande des clients que Colette sollicite un nouveau prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Colette A. is married to Ludovic Ayaba, a mason. The couple takes care of six children, five of whom are their own. For nearly ten years, Colette has lived in the Agblangandan quarter in the Sèmè-Podji commune with her husband and children. The couple handles the family's needs jointly. Colette never went to school. To help her husband out, Colette sells food items (rice, corn mush) at her house. She also sells peanut oil and cassava flour. She gets her stock from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Colette has been a long-time client of Alidé, having already received six loans that she has repaid in full. Colette's client base continues to grow and she is unable to meet the demand. She is requesting a new loan so she can meet this demand and improve her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and corn, and jugs of oil

loans.name: Kanyogoga Bakyala Tukore Group, Mubende

texts.en:
40-year-old Justine N. has, as a result of her strong resilience, operated her retail shop for the last fifteen years in a not-so-profitable area in Kanyogoga, Mubende. What has counted has been her determination to succeed in addition to her already mentioned resilience in the face of financial uncertainties. 

Justine began this business with savings from her earlier bar business. In a week, this married woman, who is also a mother to six children, makes 40,000 shillings. This, though little, has helped her stay in her business. The support of friends as also helped. She also relies on earnings from her small produce-selling business.

With this loan, Justine wants to purchase more domestic retail items that are liked and bought on a regular basis by many people in her locality: items like sugar, salt and soap.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items like sugar and soap

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is a wife of M. S., living in a city called Arifwala, in Pakistan. She is married with three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a milk seller and the younger is a vegetable seller by profession. Her daughter is just one year old.

Sugran is a very brave and happy-natured woman. She keeps a big smile on her face, which gives her family relief from their problems. She and her husband are involved in a bread-making business. They have an oven made of mud, which they heat with wood to bake bread. They sell each loaf for 5 PKR. They enjoy doing this work.

They have applied for a loan from Asasah to expand their business by buying flour in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase flour for their bread making and selling business.

loans.name: Santos Teresa

texts.es:
Santos tiene 24 años de edad, reside en El municipio de San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera tiene una hija de 7 años de edad, el negocio que posee es venta de pescado seco. 
Hace cinco años se dedica al comercio de pescado seco y tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal de San Francisco Gotera, con los ingresos de las ventas solventa los gastos de primera necesidad y estudios de su pequeña hija.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra de pescado seco, camarones, chacalines y otros productos marinos que son solicitado por los clientes, esto contribuirá a Santos a mejora el negocio, generar ingresos para que apoye a la familia.
las aspiraciones son algún día tener casa propia ,apoyar su pequeña hija termine los estudio, mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 24 years old and lives in the town of San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She is a single mother with a 7-year-old daughter. She has a business selling dried fish. Santos has made a living selling dried fish for five years and has a stand in the San Francisco Gotera town market. Her income from her sales allows her to pay for her everyday needs as well as her young daughter’s studies. Santos is now asking for a loan so that she can purchase dried fish, shrimp, and other seafood that her customers are requesting. This loan will allow Santos to improve her business and to generate income in order to help her family. Her dreams are to someday have her own house, to help her daughter finish her studies, and to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing dried fish, shrimp, and other seafood.

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante Al Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Benuat is the coordinator of his group "Mujeres adelante al progreso" 1 & 2 "Forward towards progress women". This Esperanza associate began with us because he was looking for a loan to invest in his business and his  story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. He says that his most difficult challenges are to help his community to develop more access and services.

Benuat is excited to be taking his 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for over 6 years, starting up with some savings. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying clothes and perfumes for men and women, cosmetics and some shoes. He will use the profits to invest in his business and to build a house. In his future, he sees himself running a big store. 

His group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trade zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy clothes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos O. W. is married. His business is located in a residential area at Kisumu, where he sells charcoal to households. He has been doing this business for over 12 years and has one employee. His wife is a vegetable vendor and they have five children aged between 2 and 12 years. They hope to give their children good education to the university level. 

Amos says that this business is profitable, and that the major challenge he faces is having a permanent place to do business. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy sacks of charcoal to grow his business and meet customer demands. He hopes to build a new house for his family since the house he owned was demolished by the municipal council. In the future, he dreams of diversifying to real estate business. He describes himself as being humble, god-fearing and social.

loans.use: Sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario P. is from the village of Kiburiao, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 44 years old. Hilario is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Hilario owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Hilario has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1997, Hilario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Hilario is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 23rd loan taken out by Hilario from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La Sra.  Felipa  oriunda de  Piraimiri Vallegrande Santa Cruz. Actualmente vive en la localidad del torno, Barrio Bolivia  hace 30 años, y cuenta con 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.
Estado civil: concubina hace 30 años, con el señor Ángel que se dedica a al actividad de agricultura en la zona de 3 posas San Lui. 
Actividad: venta de carne en la localidad el Torno, hace 6 años en el sector de pollos. El destino del crédito: para la compra de lechones, para las fiestas festivas para engordarlos. y el resto para aumentar capital de trabajo, doña Felipa se encuentra muy agradecida con la institución por haberle brindado el apoyo para poder crecer con su negocio y al mismo tiempo hacerla sentir mejor persona .
texts.en:
Miss Felipa is from Piraimiri Vallegrande Santa Cruz. She has lived in El Torno, Bolivia Neighbourhood, for 30 years. She has 2 school-aged children. Marital status: she has lived with Mr Ángel for 30 years. He farms in the 3 Posas San Lui zone. Business: Meat sales in the El Torno town. She has worked in the chicken sector for 6 years. The use of the loan: for the purchase of suckling pugs for festive holidays to fatten them up. The rest of the loan is to increase working capital. Felipa is very grateful to the Institucion for offering her the support to grow with her business and at the same time making her feel like a better person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of suckling pigs

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motivo para salir adelante. Hace muchos años atrás trabajaba en una empresa textil, en ese tiempo aprendió todo sobre este oficio, es así que fue el inicio para que emprendiera su propio negocio, que es la elaboración de bolsos juveniles. En la actualidad trabaja en un mercado en el área de control de calidad, lugar donde aprovecha para ofrecer a sus compañeros de trabajo y amistades los bolsos y carteras que fabrica. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que no invierte tiempo en ello, además le es muy rentable, generándole  buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en la educación de sus hijos.  Lleva 5 años realizando su negocio con mucho entusiasmo, asimismo su esposo la apoya en el trabajo, dándole los materiales necesarios que necesita. En adelante, lo que más desea es terminar de construir su casa, para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, y se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de materiales e incluso incrementará la compra de más bolsos y carteras para llegar a más clientes.
texts.en: Rocío, 42, is a hardworking woman who lives in her home along with her husband and two children. They are her motivation to succeed. Many years ago she worked for a textile company, and at the time, had learned everything there was to know about that profession. That is why she decided to start her own business which makes and sells handbags. She  now works at a market in the area of quality control, and while there sells bags and purses to her friends and coworkers. What she likes most about her business is that it generates good income without taking up too much time, which allows her to help educate her children. She has been doing business enthusiastically for five years, and her husband has been simultaneously supporting her with work by getting her the necessary materials that she needs. In the future, what she most wants is to finish construction on her house in order to make her family safer. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she promises to make her payments on time. She will use to loan to buy materials and increase the number of bags and purses so she can get more customers.

loans.use: buy materials to make bags and purses

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik K. is a widow and lives with her two daughters, one of whom is a student and the other helps her mother running the business. Life conditions brought Knarik to be engaged in this business. It has been seven years that she has been selling men’s clothing. Knarik’s customers like her for her kindness, consideration and the clothing she offers. 

Currently, Knarik needs to expand her business by purchasing new inventory, for which she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel B. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Raquel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste, soft drinks, rice, bread, etc. in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raquel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Raquel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 54 años,  está casado con Demetria, de 56 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos; todos ellos mayores de edad. Pero como buenos padres siempre los visitan, ya que viven solo en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Centro Huachirick. El trabajo que desempeña, es la agricultura. Sus plantaciones de café, achiote, palta y plátano, son frutos que tiene mucha demanda dentro de su localidad, ya que su experiencia durante estos 25 años demuestran su superioridad en las técnicas de cultivo y eso se ve en la calidad de estos frutos. En estos últimos años Félix, se siente alegre por los éxitos obtenidos, es por ello que en cada cosecha, tiene buen juicio para poder vender sus productos a buen precio; sin embargo lo que desea Félix es ahorrar mayor cantidad de dinero y comprarse una casa en la ciudad, de esa manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, y ayudarle a tener su propio negocio, para ello instalará una tienda de venta de comestibles. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y, se muestra satisfecho por el apoyo que le brindan en su banco comunal; donde cada día siente mayor apreció. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar 10 sacos de abono orgánico, para sus plantaciones de café, que dará fruto en el mes de mayo y, si el dinero le alcanza, invertirá en el cultivo de 7 hectáreas de achiote.
texts.en:
Félix, 54, is married to Demetria, 56.  They have four adult children.  Like all good parents, however, they visit often.  They live alone in their own house located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik.

He is a coffee, achiote (small tropical shrub), avocado and banana farmer, all fruits that are in high demand in his locality.  His 25 years of experience have paid off in his superior techniques and high quality of products.

The last few years Félix has felt very cheerful thanks to the successes he’s had.  This is why he figures out at each harvest the way to get the very best sales prices for his products.  However, what Félix wants most is to save money to buy a house in the city so that he can provide his wife with better quality of life and help her have her own business; to do that, he plans to open a grocery store.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is satisfied with the support his communal bank provides where every day he feels more esteem.

He will use the requested funds to buy 10 sacks of organic manure for his coffee plants which will bear fruit in May.  If the money goes far enough, he will also invest in planting 7 hectares of achiote.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of manure.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem C., 31, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. C. is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband sells salt, earning an income of USD 4 per day. 

C. spends USD 45 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to transport salt. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and trailer to transport salt

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live in Siem Reap province. Sin K., age 25, has been selected to be the leader of the group. 

Sin K. is a ticket seller at private company in Siem Reap Province. Sin K. was married for many years, but she has been divorced from her husband for a few years. Sin K. has two kids who are still studying in school. Presently, Sin K. is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

The other three borrowers include: 

Mrs. Lim V., a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to buy some pieces wood to repair her broken house.
Mrs. Uch R., who will use this loan to purchase a used motorbike to replace the old one.
Mrs. Sin P., who is asking for a loan to buy fishing equipment for her fishing business.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Angela Trinidad

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

En este lugar encontramos a la  señora Angela. Tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, además esta criando un niño de tres años el cual lo cogió a su cargo cuando la mama  murió y es como su hijo. Los tres viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer de taxi. Lleva 3 años  en el  Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta además también vende en su  casa, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas  y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la compra en  Guayaquil, Portoviejo y otra parte la compra en Quito, este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa como. Pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of verdant mountains and enchanting landscapes, we find the place where the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

This is where we find Ms. Angela.  She is 50 years old, married, and has two grown children from her marriage.  She is also raising a three year-old boy whom she took into her care when his mother died, and he is like her own child.  The three of them live together in her house.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and likes it because the interest rates are very low.

Angela sells all types of clothing.  She sells from door-to-door as well as from her house, taking orders from her customers.  She works every morning and all day on weekends.  She offers products to her customers on credit and then collects payments every 15 days.  She buys some of her merchandise in Guayaquil and Portoviejo and the rest in Quito.  She started this business with the first loan she received through Fundación ESPOIR.

She is taking out this loan to buy clothing like pants, shirts, blouses, etc.  Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Sibia

texts.en:
Sibia has a mixed farm in Nyamira town in western Kenya that procudes tea, milk, and vegetables. She has been in the farming business for twenty years and employs 5 farmhands. She also earns income from the sale of cereals to the local market. Her biggest challenge in this business has been  the lack of organized markets for her products.

She has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will be used to improve her farm and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to improve her tea plantation and own at least 5 dairy cows.

Sibia is 40 years old and married with 5 children between the ages of 17 and 20. Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en:
Jacklin L. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Jacklin has a brick-making business, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Jacklin has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more firewood for firing the bricks and to pay her workers. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jacklin hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own another business selling fish.
Jacklin is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living (for example, having good clothes to wear and eating good food).

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for firing bricks, and pay her workers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy D. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Nancy owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She wants to be a successful businesswoman. 

Nancy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is purchasing of products.

She has operated a natural tiens Tianshi medicine selling business (traditional Chinese medicine) for over a year, selling in a shop to her local neighbors. Margaret faces a major challenge of competition from other tiens products sellers in the area. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase natural tiens Tianshi medicine products to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase natural tiens Tianshi medicine products to sell

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou L. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Annalou is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Annalou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Annalou has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Annalou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalou is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Annalou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.en:
Abdusalom is a responsible husband and a loving father of four children. He is engaged in the production of dried fruit. Abdusalom buys the fruit from a market area and sells in a local market as a wholesaler. He has been in this business for 10 years. He started his business with a small amount of fruit. Today, he has extensive experience.

 Abdusalom would like to get a loan of 6000 Somoni to expand his business. He wants to grow his business and promises to repay the current loan without any violations and thanks all lenders for their support.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried fruit.

loans.name: Inkezo Group

texts.en:
Doris is 44 years old and married with five children, between the ages of 14 and 24; three of them attend school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni, South Africa. In the photo she is in green, raising her hand.

She’s been in her business for five years and sells Avon products and cleaning materials door-to-door. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy cleaning materials. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who take her products on credit and fail to pay on time.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her have a proper shelter. In future she sees herself  having an office at the mall to sell her Avon products and as having employees.

She adds that WDB has helped her so much with the loans and she now sees a future in her life.

loans.use: To buy cleaning materials for resale.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, 33 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Batbayar’s wife is looking after her baby at the moment. Batbayar works two jobs. He works in a tire repair garage as a mechanic and he transports people around the city in his taxi. He has been running a taxi since 2005. 

Mr. Batbayar's family lives in ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The ger is now very old and needs to be replaced. The ger has a wooden frame construction and is covered with sheep wool felt. The loan Mr. Batbayar is taking will be used to buy a new ger for his family. A small part of the loan will be used to service his car.

loans.use: To buy a new ger for his family. A portion of the loan will be used to service his car.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara D. 43 años D. edad, es madre D. familia, cuenta con casa propiadonD. vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, la   misma que tiene los servicios D. luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del caserío D. Simbila que pertenece al distrito D. Catacao, a unos 30 minutos del departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería y artesanía (alfarería y metalurgia).

Clara desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y luego pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado Clara un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales D. raza para mejorar la calidad D. los mismos, con la finalidad D. obtener un mejor precio en los mercado donD. los ofrece en venta como a su clientela que le compra  y así mejoraría  su calidad D. vida.

Clara es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio cresca cada vez más y que su familia tenga otras oportunidades en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Clara, 43, lives in her own house with her husband and 3 children. The house only has electricity services and is located in the rural area of the hamlet of Simbila in the district of  Catacao, about 30 minutes away from the  department  of Piura. The main activities in the area are agriculture, livestock and crafts (pottery and metal work).

For the last few years Clara has been raising and selling pigs. She keeps them just outsiD. her house and feeds them a balanced meal to ensure they reach their optimum growth. Then she sells them in different markets in the area and obtains a good income to cover her family expenses. 

Clara has requested Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 2,000 soles to buy fine breed animals to improve the quality of her livestock, so as to obtain a better price for them in the markets where she sells them to her customers. This will improve her quality of life. 

Clara is a very responsible and hard working person who just wants her business to grow and her family to benefit from opportunities in society.

loans.use: to buy fine breed pigs to improve the livestock she breeds.

loans.name: Mabel Yurema

texts.es:
Mabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos, la señora  estudio educación secundaria. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace cuatro años,  su préstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de ataúdes (funeraria).
Mabel solicitará un nuevo préstamo por  la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de ataúdes, para luego venderlos. Trabaja sola ya que su esposo es ingeniero civil y se dedica a elaborar proyectos.  
Su sueño es tener más funerarias en Juliaca, Ilave.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y que las socias son divertidas.
texts.en:
Mabel is a member of the “Uniòn Arco Deustua” communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She is 35 years old, has a spouse and three children.  She finished middle school.

She’s worked with the Manuela R. Movement for four years.  Her previous, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her business selling coffins (funeral parlor).

Mabel will ask for a new loan in the amount of 1000 new soles, money she’ll use to buy coffins to later sell.  She works alone since her husband’s a Civil Engineer and he works developing projects.  Her dream is to have more funeral parlors in Juliaca an Ilave.

What she likes about the communal bank are the training sessions and that the members are fun.

loans.use: to buy coffins.

loans.name: Khishigdelger

texts.en:
Khishigdelger is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local kindergarten. Khishigdelger’s family owns a plot of land and small family house. Khishigdelger works as salesperson at one of the indoor markets selling sunglasses and spectacles. Her husband used to work at a taxi company as a driver but lost his job due to reorganization in the company. 

Khishigdelger is requesting a loan to buy a family car and use it to start a taxi business for her husband to give him a chance to earn money. Her loan will be used for 40 percent of the payment for the car and she will provide the other 60 percent from her savings. The car will be used by her husband to taxi passengers and provide extra income to the family.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to start a taxi business

loans.name: Yobesh

texts.en:
Yobesh is 40 years old and a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last four years, he has been doing a welding business. He wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy iron sheets and square tubes.

He has a dream of building rental houses in the future. He is thankful to Faulu Kenya for helping him to learn the art of keeping business records.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and square tubes

loans.name: Lhen

texts.en:
Lhen is married and is 34 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of groceries. Lhen has had this business for four years. She is thankful because she is blessed with five children. 

Lhen is requesting for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional groceries, such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessity items. Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she would like to have additional stocks of groceries so that she can minimize her expenses in going to and from the market. Each month, Lhen is able to earn about PHP 10,000 from her grocery business.

In the future, Lhen hopes to improve her shop so that she can encourage more customers to buy at her store. She thus also hopes that she can obtain the loan amount that she has requested so that she can maintain her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, noodles and other basic grocery items for resale.

location.town: Aurora Villa Magat San Mateo, Isabela

loans.name: Las Amazonas Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de Caacupé, está integrado por 11 mujeres de la misma ciudad, todas ellas son vecinas y amigas. Tienen un fin en común que es el de conseguir más ingresos para llevarlos a la casa y de esa forma poder solventar los gastos diarios de la casa. Ellas trabajan en un ambiente de respeto, donde lo primordial es el trabajo en equipo y la solidaridad las unas con las otras.
La Señora Ramona, está casada y tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde hace unos años. Con esto ha podido ayudar a su marido en los gastos que implica mantener una casa. Comenta que tiene una gran demanda, especialmente los fines de semana gracias a que es muy conocida en el barrio, y en las zonas aledañas. Sueña con poder ampliar su negocio para poder tener más capacidad de almacenaje.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, whiskys y vinos para abastecer su stock de bebidas. Está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The 11 women in this committee are from the city of Caacupé, they are all neighbors and friends in this city. They all have a goal in common, which is to earn more income to take home and so to be able to pay their daily household expenses. They work in a respectful manner, where the most important things are teamwork and solidarity, each looking out for the others. 
Ramona is married and has children. She has been working for some years selling drinks, and with this job she has been able to help her husband with the expenses that come with running their household. She comments that there is great demand for her goods, especially at the weekend. She is well known in the neighborhood and also in the surrounding areas. She dreams of being able to grow her business and have more storage capacity. 
She is requesting a loan to buy beer, whisky, and wine to increase her stock of drinks. She is very hopeful about the loan, as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: Compra de cervezas, whiskys y vinos para abastecer su stock de bebidas

loans.name: Gulanda's Group

texts.en:
Businesswomen of rural communities in Kyrgyzstan face a double challenge. The first challenge is being in a vulnerable part of the country; the second – being a woman. 

Gulanda, 46, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and has two daughters, the older of whom is 20. The year of 1996 was a turning point in Gulanda’s life. She risked all her savings by investing them in a purchase of 5 head of cattle, which left her  with almost no funds to live on. Having two kids to feed, Gulanda had no time to hesitate and she quickly started to work on promoting the business. It was repaid and currently she owns up to 40 head of livestock, which is the biggest herd in the neighborhood. Her monthly profit is about 5,000 soms. She doesn’t plan to stop at this and looks forward to expanding the herd. The purpose of the loan is to purchase 3-4 goats. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 51 años, está casada con Aurelio. Ambos tienen una hija, Magaly de 17 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La zona alta de Unión, es propicia para brindar granos de buena calidad, sus tierras fértiles son adecuadas y buenas para brindar el grano de café con buen aroma. Es por ello que todos los fines de semana en compañía de su esposo cuidan de sus cultivos de café, ya tiene 16 años dedicándose a ello y según menciona sus granos son muy reconocidos en la cooperativa de Alto Palomar, donde vende en cada campaña agrícola. Cuenta que constantemente realiza viveros de café, con los cuales renuevan sus plantaciones antiguas, ahora tienen 3 mil plantitas en proceso de germinación; con ello esperan tener nuevos y mejores granos. Además menciona que su esposo trabaja en una panadería. Todas las mañanas de lunes a viernes desde muy temprano él, se dirige a una fuente de soda donde trabaja, ahí elabora los ricos panes y pasteles que deleitan todas las mañanas a los pobladores de su localidad. Donde obtiene un dinero extra; es así que esperan juntar lo necesario para comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la unión palomar” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera salir adelante con el apoyo de su banco comunal, los que trabajaran arduamente para salir adelante. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Gladys de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden en la limpieza, poda y macheteo de sus plantaciones de café. Asimismo comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para sus viveros.
texts.en: Gladys is 51 years old and is married to Aurelio. They have a daughter, Magaly, who is 17 years old. They live together in a house of their own, located in Unión Palomar (Peru's central rainforest). The upper region of Unión is good for growing high-quality grains; its fertile land is well-suited for coffee beans with a good aroma. That is why every weekend she and her husband care for their coffee crops. They have done it for 16 years, and their beans are very well-recognized at the Alto Palomar cooperative, where she sells in every agricultural season. She says that she continually maintains coffee nurseries, with which they renew their old plantations. They now have three thousand plantlings in germination; with these they hope to have new and better beans. She also says that her husband works in a bakery. Every morning, Monday to Friday, he goes very early to a shop where he works; there he makes the rich bread and pastry that delight the residents of their town every morning. This is where he makes extra money, which is how they hope to gather what they need to buy more agricultural land. She belongs to the community bank "Prestatarios de la unión palomar" ("Unión Palomar Borrowers"), and this is her first loan with MFP. She hopes to get ahead with the support of her community bank, those who will work hard to get ahead. She also promises to make her repayments promptly. Gladys, upon receiving your support, will use the loan to hire workers to help her with cleaning, pruning, and cutting on her coffee plantations. She will also buy several bags of natural fertilizers for her nurseries.

loans.use: hire workers and buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye est un jeune habitant du Sénégal. Il est ag é de 28 ans et a une double activité. C’est un maçon  qui pratique aussi l’aviculture qu’il a hérité de son oncle qu’il aidait  souvent. Il a une expérience de 5 ans dans ses activités. Il est surtout intéressé  par l’aspect lucratif de ces activités qui lui permettent  d’arrondir ses fins de mois. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2005. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 fr prévu pour l’achat d’aliments destiné a renforcer le poids de ses sujets a abattre a a vendre pendant la fête de korité. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer ses gains financiers.
texts.en: Mr. Mbaye is a young Senegalese man.  He is 28 years old and does two types of work.   He is a mason who also raises poultry, a business he inherited from his uncle, whom he often helped.  He has five years of experience in this area.  He is interested, above all, in the profits to be made which allow him to make ends meet at the end of the month.  He has been a member of the U-IMCEC since June of 2005.  He is requesting a credit of 200,000 FR to buy feed to put weight on the chickens which he prepares for cooking to be sold at the festival of Korité.  This loan will allow him to increase his income.

loans.use: to by feed

loans.name: Wiñay Huayna Group

texts.es:
El señor Manuel nació en la ciudad D. Juliaca del departamento D. Puno, Actualmenrte, él vive en la ciudad del Cusco. (En la fotografía el señor Manuel está levantando la mano). 

El señor Manuel está casado y fruto D. esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, él es una padre trabajador y responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos, él es representante D. una empresa privada y trabaja reclutando personas para incluirlas en unas redes D. mercados, él cuando capta a las personas les venD. un producto nutricional y a su vez estas personas hacen lo mismo reclutando personas y se convierten en una redes D. mercados. Ya son tres años que participa en este tipo D. negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

El señor Manuel pertenece al banco comunal “Wiñay Huayna” y en esta oportunidad Manuel requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales didácticos para capacitar o reclutar a las personas. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Huayna” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad D. Cusco  y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. artesanía, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. comida  y otras actividades. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel was born in Juliaca, a city in the Department of Puno. He currently lives in the city of Cusco. (Señor Manuel has his hand raised in the photo).

Señor Manuel is married and his two children are the product of his happy relationship. He is a hard-working and responsible father who supports his children. He is a representative of a private company and he recruits people to be included in various market networks. When he recruits people he sells them a nutritional product and in turn these people do the same, recruiting other people to incluD. them in the market networks. He has now been participating in this type of business for three years and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Señor Manuel is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiñay Huayna” and on this occasion he requires a loan to buy educational material to train and recruit people.

The members of the Communal Bank “Wiñay Huayna” meet every thirty days in the city of Cusco. The Communal Bank is maD. up of hard-working and enterprising people who are constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead and to create a better future for their children through their daily efforts. The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco and the economic activities of the other members are, for example, art sales, cosmetic sales and food sales among other activities.

Cusco is an area known for its tourism, commercialism, for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and also because “Machupicchu”, one of the seven wonders of the world, is found there.

loans.use: to buy educational material to train or recruit people.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.
 
Lolita has a tailoring shop where she makes & sells school & office uniforms. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy cloth for dressmaking.

Lolita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth for dressmaking

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 25-year-old, married man living in Ain with his wife and little child. Adel has been selling fresh chicken since 2003 and is working hard on improving his business. Adel is well known in the region and most of his clients are neighboring villagers. 
His business is well developed because of the good quality of products he serves and his prices.
To provide his family with a better lifestyle, Adel opened a bakery to increase his income and improve his family’s social and financial situations.
Adel is working with his father; they are sharing and improving the same businesses. That’s why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy chicken at special prices.
This is Adel’s forth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. All his previous loans helped a lot in increasing his business capital and improving his workplace.  He has a good standing as a borrower.
He hopes to continue improving his business, to expand and be the owner of a big chicken farm.

loans.use: To buy chicken at special prices

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 47 years old and has six children with ages ranging between 6 and 25. All of Jacqueline’s children attend school except the youngest. Her husband does not work. Jacqueline sells different items such as potatoes, bananas and many others. She has been doing this business for six years. She plans to use the profits that will be obtained from the business for school fees for her children. Jacqueline dreams to have a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale.

loans.name: Okello

texts.en:
Okello is 50 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past three years, Okello has been working hard to manage his farm supply business, which sells fertilizers, pesticides and seeds. 

To help expand his business, Okello has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more farm supplies and will help Okello to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Okello hopes that in the future he will be able to grow the business to attract farmers from all corners of the district. 

Okello is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Okello who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more farm supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Ruth sells ready to wear clothes.  She has been in business for five years.  She requests a loan of 50,000 to purchase additional ready to wear clothes to sell.

In the future, Ruth hopes to see her children finish college.  Ruth has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se, 41, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Se produces scarves to sell, and her husband is a farmer. 

Se is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to provide transportation services. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Eduvi

texts.es:
Eduvi  tiene  33 años de edad tiene 3 hijos ella es comerciante, su nivel de estudio es básico solo llego hasta el cuarto grado de primaria. 
Inicio su negocio de venta de ropa con un préstamo cuando tenía 25 años de edad. Antes ella se dedicaba a vender enchiladas y frescos de manera ambulante pero ella tenia la meta de un día lograr tener su propia tiene da en su casa de tal manera que pudiera compartir mas tiempo con sus hijos sin dejar de aportar en el hogar. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas,celulares. Pues se acerca ala época navideña y necesita tener mercadería variada para vender.  Una de sus expectativas es seguir prosperando  su tienda e ir haciendo mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Eduvi is 33 years old and has 3 children. She is a merchant. Her level of study is basic, only making it to the 4th grade of primary school.
She started her business in the sale of clothing with a loan when she was 25 years old. Before that she sold enchiladas and drinks for a living as a mobile vendor, but she had the goal of one day having her own house so that she would be able to share more time with her children and continue earn money from home. She is requesting a loan to buy shirts, pants, dresses, blouses and cell phones. As the holiday season approaches, she needs to have varied merchandise to sell. One of her expectations is for her store to continue to prosper and to continue making improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, dresses, blouses and cell phones.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has a cafe and lives in Likoni, Kenya. She began the business from the funds she obtained from a ‘merry go round’; a scheme where people come together and contribute equal amounts of money and lend to one person at a time. Her business has been in operation for the last two years. She learnt of Milango through her friends. 

Susan is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase foodstuffs for her café and also to carry out farming. The main challenges she faces are theft, inflation and some customers not paying on time. 

Her future plans include building commercial houses. Susan will use the extra income to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for her café and also to carry out farming.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en equipo. Todas son mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras, que se esfuerzan día a día por darle lo mejor a sus familias. El grupo actualmente se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
