Una de las miembros es Gloria, quien se dedica a la peluquería, nos comenta que siempre esta con muchos clientes gracias a la buena atención que les brinda. Gracias a su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de Shampoo, enjuagues, tintes para pelos, spray y demás insumos necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
17 women from Ciudad del Este have come together with the intention of helping one another by working as a team. They are all fighting and hardworking women who make an effort day after day to give the best to their families. The group is currently in its third loan cycle of the foundation's program for enterprising women.

One of the members is Gloria, who works in hairstyling. She tells us that she always has a lot of customers thanks to the attentiveness she gives them. Thanks to her business she's been able to get ahead and help her family. She wants to be able to continue growing and this is why she always tries hard. She's asking for a loan to buy shampoo, rinses, hair dyes, hairspray, and other supplies necessary for her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, hair dyes, hairspray, and other supplies.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla, 42 years old, is the mother of three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a worker earning a low income. For the past 5 years, Khawla has been making embroideries for sale. She wants to bulk purchase missing textiles and threads necessary to make embroideries for resale, but the family income is low and not enough to cover these expenses. Khawla needs to take a loan from FATEN to purchase these materials to continue her work as she has a lot of customer requests for her embroideries. This loan will enable her to increase her embroideries and her sales, which will improve her income and offer better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and threads.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria se sigue dedicando al negocio de desayunos,ella prepara quinua,quaker,chocolate y maca,ella vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hsta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los desayunos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los desayunos como panes,leche,quinua y maca al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Victoria, is still working in her breakfast business. She prepares quinoa, quaker oats, chocolate and maca. She works as a street vendor. The member works from 8.00 am until 6.00 pm. Through this business she is getting her children ahead in life. Her dream is to have a premises where she can sell the breakfasts. The member is requesting the loan to buy wholesale ingredients to prepare breakfasts, such as bread, milk, quinoa and maca.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients to prepare breakfasts, such as bread, milk, quinoa and maca.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El señor Anastacio es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha dedicado en ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace 2 años el inicio como chofer de taxi en una tienda comercial de la ciudad, ofreciendo el servicio hasta sus casas a un bajo precio. 

Hace pocos días les solicitaron que pintaran los taxis de acuerdo a la empresa para la que están asociados, tenían que llevar los colores  logotipos ya que es una manera de prevención para detectar a los taxis que son piratas. 

Pero Anastacio no cuenta con el dinero por tal motivo solicita de su apoyo para comprar la pintura y mano de obra. De esta manera no tendrá que suspender sus labores.
texts.en:
Anastacio is a very hardworking man who always has worked offering his family a better quality of life.  Two years ago he began as a taxi driver in a commercial store in the city, offering service home at a low price.

A few days ago they asked them to paint the taxis in accordance with the business with which they are associated.  The taxis had to be the colors of the logo because it is a preventive way to detect pirate taxis.

But Anastacio does not have the money.  For this reason he is requesting your support to buy the paint and labor, so he will not have to suspend his work.

loans.use: to buy paint and pay for labor for his taxi.

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: Jorge Armando de 49 años, vive con su grupo familiar su compañera de vida y con dos hijos, uno de 15 y otro de 17 años, ambos estudiando en la escuela. Es un hombre muy trabajador que se ha dedicado toda su vida al cultivo de maíz, frijol, sorgo, entre otros. Es el único que trabaja en su hogar es por eso que cuenta también con un segundo trabajo que es de jornalero, este oficio consiste en la realización de diversas actividades agrícolas para otro dueño de cultivos, siendo esta una fuente de ingreso con la que Jorge puede complementar los gastos del hogar. Desde hace un tiempo se ha visto en la necesidad de incrementar sus cultivos y es por eso que decidió acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y así poder comprar insumos básicos como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, y a su vez cuenta con la seguridad que con la ayuda percibida el podrá entregarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia y podrá solventar la deuda sin problema alguno.

loans.use: Para comprar insumos básicos como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr: Samuel est un homme de 36 marié père de 05 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 16 ans. Il est commerçant et à ouvert un petit kiosque qu'il gère lui même depuis 3 ans. c'est grâce à son petit commerce qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. son petit commerce marche bien, mais se pose un problème de rupture permanente de son stock ( lait, sucreries, cigarettes, crédit de communication...)ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à faire écouler une bonne partie de son stock avant de se réapprovisionner. d'où l'importance de ce crédit qui permettra d'augmenter non seulement ses ventes, mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. benéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Samuel is a 36-year old man who is married and father to five children, ranging from 10 to 16 years old. He is a trader and has set up a small stand which he has been managing himself for the past three years. Thanks to this small business he is able to provide for his family's needs. Although his business is working well, he has a permanent shortage of stock owing to the small amount of capital he has, and this obliges him to sell off a large part of his stock before he is able to replenish it. This loan is thus important to him because it will enable him not only to increase his sales, but also his profit margin. His profits will be partly reinvested in his business and the rest will be used to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his stock.

loans.name: Koku Mensah

texts.en:
Mr Mensah Koku A. was born in 1974 at Tsevié. Married, and the father of three children, he is also still responsible for his younger brother. Due to a lack of support, he had to end his studies at level five and start a small business, which he manages marvellously. However, a shortage of funds prevents his business from developing any further. Thanks to his first loan of $100, which he repaid regularly with no problems, Mr A. gained the necessary experience to manage a more substantial loan. His last two fully repaid loans, of $250 and $550 respectively, strengthen the trust deserved by a loyal and creditworthy client.

Mr Mensah Koku A. is asking for a loan of $900, which will be used to stock up with essential products from the wholesalers. This project will allow him to grow his business, increase his income, and improve living conditions for his family who count on him alone.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koku Mensah est né en 1974 à Tsévié. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il a encore son petit frère à sa charge. Par manque de support, il a dû arrêter ses études en classe de 5ème et s’est lancé très tôt dans le petit commerce qu’il gère à merveille. Toutefois, l’insuffisance de fonds fait que son commerce n’évolue pas assez bien. Ainsi, grâce à un premier crédit de $100 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé sans incident, Monsieur A. Koku Mensah a acquis une expérience qui lui permet de gérer un crédit plus consistant. Ses deux derniers crédits respectifs de $250 et $550 parfaitement bien remboursés renforcent toute la confiance que l’on peut avoir à un client fidèle et solvable.

Monsieur A. Koku Mensah sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $900 qui va servir à s’approvisionner chez les grossistes des produits de première nécessité. Ce projet lui permettra d’accroître ses affaires pour augmenter ses revenus et de facto améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille qui ne compte que lui seul.

loans.use: to stock up with essential products from the wholesalers

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has been through the TEACH Lending program. She understands simple book-keeping techniques and needs a loan of $700 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Mrs. Oanh is 45 years old. Her husband, Su, is 47 years old. They have a son and a daughter who stopped attending school in order to find money. They have no land aside from a small hut. Daily, Oanh works at small shop that supplies breakfast food. Oanh’s family income is $8 per person/month. Oanh hopes to receive a loan of $75 to run her breakfast shop. Oanh is going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To run the breakfast shop.

loans.name: Dexy

texts.es:
Business Description

Dexy L. sells paper products and plastic products for the home (pails, trays, clothes baskets, and so on). She began this business with her husband's help when they both found themselves unemployed. As of today, she sells her line of household products from home, and her husband sells them door to door.

Purpose of the Loan

Dexy would use the loan to buy more inventory and make a few improvements in her home shop. Because client demand is high, she needs the extra inventory.

About the Applicant

Dexy is thirty. She has a son who goes to school. Her husband helps her run the household, and the family is stable. Her goal is to expand her home shop so that her husband would no longer have to sell door to door, unless he could get a shop of his own.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Dexy tiene a la venta productos de papelería, plástico (cubetas bandejas, cestos, otros). Ella comenzó este negocio con ayuda de su esposo cuando ambos quedaron desempleados. Actualmente ella vende sus productos en casa y su esposo va a ofrecer sus productos de forma ambulante

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y hacer una adecuaciones que necesita el local. Por motivo de que sus clientes le piden mas productos ella se ve en la necesidad de satisfacer la demanda.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 30 años y un hijo que estudia su casa es de cemento esposo le ayuda en la casa y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su meta es de poder ampliar su local para que su esposo ya no tenga que salir a vender los productos sino que tenga otro local similar

loans.use: To buy paper and plastic household goods for resale

loans.name: Imoa

texts.en: Imoa, 42 years old, of Manunu, has a sewing business. After she joined SPBD, she was able to run her own sewing business, which helps with the development of her family. Her husband has a plantation, which also supports the family, but Imoa now has her own source of income and can make her own children’s clothes. Imoa is also one of the many women that are grateful for SPBD’s assistance as she now has her own business. While she had the skills to sew, it was not until she received assistance from SPBD that she could now really put her sewing skills to good use.

loans.use: For a sewing machine, school fees, and home improvement

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela is 55 years old and for the past thirty-four years she and her inseparable husband Nicolás have dedicated themselves to making beautiful pieces of pottery (cooking pots, flower pots) made using mud and clay. Thanks to their agile and creative hands their work has achieved an excellent quality. This work has allowed them to obtain a good income that satisfactorily covers the expenses of their home and schooling for their five children. Now, after many years and despite their advanced age, they want to continue expanding their work and merchandise to be able to export throughout the world. In order to make that happen they have diligently wrapped themselves in this noble labor and at the same time are asking for a loan of $500 dollars, money that they will invest in the purchase of raw materials (clay, wood) for the elaboration of their flower and cooking pots. Furthermore, they promise to repay the loan in the space of seven months. Your generous support will be a wise investment in the hands of this enterprising pair. Give them the opportunity to increase the satisfaction of their large family with their small business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángela tiene 55 años de edad y junto a su inseparable esposo Nicolás están dedicados hace treinta y cuatro años a realizar hermosos trabajos de alfarería (ollas, maceteros) fabricados utilizando barro y arcilla, gracias a sus ágiles y creativas manos lograron realizar excelentes trabajos de calidad; permitiéndoles obtener mediante este oficio buenos ingresos económicos, para cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de sus cinco hijos.Ahora, después de muchos años y pese a la avanzada edad de cada uno aún están deseosos de seguir expandiendo sus trabajos y mercadería hasta llegar a exportar al mundo entero; para lograrlo se desenvuelven diligentemente en esta noble labor y al mismo tiempo solicitan un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirán en la compra materia prima (arcilla, leña) para la elaboración de sus maceteros y ollitas, así mismo prometen reembolsarles el préstamo en un lapso de siete meses.“Tu aporte generoso será una inversión sabia en las manos de esta emprendedora pareja, dales la oportunidad de incrementar las satisfacciones de su numerosa familia con su pequeño negocio”

loans.use: Purchase raw material and fuel for finishing clay pots

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
Mr. Aquilino married 14 years ago, and from this union with his loyal wife Daria, two enchanting daughters were born. Since then with much hard work and sacrifice, they were able to buy a vehicle with the intention of offering transportation services to the rural public. In addition, they also decided to dedicate themselves to the commercialization of andean products such as chuño (freeze dried potato product), potatoes, and quinoa, as traveling salesman in their native city Ayaviri and neighboring towns. The dream of this couple is to have more merchandise and a locale in the central market of their town. To reach this objective, they ask for a loan in order to increase the amount and variety of their products and above all acquire their desired sales locale. Aquilino and Daria promise to pay back the loan in 6 months. Let's support them, they're looking forward to your helping hand to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West Kiva volunteer.

Don Aquilino, contrajo matrimonio hace 14 años, fruto de su unión con Daría, su fiel esposa, nacieron dos encantadoras niñas, desde entonces con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, lograron comprar un vehículo con el fin de ofrecer servicio de movilidad a la población rural, adicionalmente a este trabajo decidieron dedicarse a la comercialización de productos andinos (chuño, papa, quinua) en forma ambulatoria en su ciudad, natal, Ayaviri y pueblitos limítrofes.El deseo de esta pareja es contar con más mercadería y con un puesto seguro de ventas dentro del mercado central de su ciudad. Para alcanzar este objetivo desean obtener un préstamo a fin de aumentar la cantidad y variedad de sus productos y sobre todo adquirir su anhelado puesto de ventas.Aquilino y Daría Prometen reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses, ¡Apóyalos, ellos esperan tu mano amiga para salir adelante”.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and variety of andean products to offer in the market of their city.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum T. is 35 years old and married with four children. She works with her husband on a piece of land growing various vegetables; together they earn around $4.80 each day. One of her children is employed by a private company and makes $1.60 each day, while her remaining children are in school.

Prum wants to raise her income generation by expanding the quantity of her crops and needs a water-pump machine to increase her water supply. This loan will enable her cultivation to grow steadily.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump to provide water for their crops.

loans.name: Mulyati

texts.en: Mulyati is 37 years old, and married to Z., who has no fixed job. She must earn the stable income for her family. In order to do this, she sells cosmetics such as powder, perfumes, and other beauty products. She operates a door-to-door vending service, and makes a total of $10 a week. She is asking for a loan of $175, and plans to repay in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Melardo

texts.es:
Melardo is 38-years-old, is the father of 6 children, and is a very active man. He also has a business where he sells groceries and candy. He works in a public organization that is very well known in the region. When he is on vacation, he dedicates himself fully to selling groceries, since he considers himself an active and hard-working man. He hopes to increase the quantity of articles that he offers so his family can fulfill their dreams with the help of the income that this occupation will offer them in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Melardo de 38 años de edad, es padre de seis hijos, es un hombre muy activo pues adicionalmente de tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas, trabaja en una entidad pública muy reconocida en la región y cuando está de vacaciones se dedica íntegramente a la venta de abarrotes pues se considera un hombre activo y trabajador.Desea incrementar la cantidad de artículos que oferta a fin de que su familia logre concretar sus sueños con ayuda de los ingresos que esta ocupación le otorgue en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase the quantity and variety of the products he offers

loans.name: Bertha's Tuinome Group

texts.en:
Bertha is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 5 years old. Bertha is a soft drinks seller and she started her business in 2004. Everyday she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealings in chicken sales and soft drinks sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo is a 34 year old mother of two. She lives in the Tabata area of Dar Es Salaam. She runs a wholesale shop that sells cosmetics, a business that is becoming common among Dar es Salaam traders. She is in need of a loan to help her expand the business.

loans.use: To help expand her wholesale cosmetics business

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat M., 38, and her husband, Mr. Channy Trok, 38, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1993 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. All of them are in local schools.

Mrs. Sinat has been selling sugar cane juice, soft drinks and plastic covers for books in front of one high school in Phnom Penh for ten years, while Mr. Channy has been a motor taxi driver for over ten years. Both of them earned for living about US$8.67 per day. Now Sinat wants to create another business selling cell phone prepaid cards. She will buy cell phone prepaid cards from the mobile phone company to resell at her shop.

So, she is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase cell phone prepaid cards and some amount for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone’s prepaid card for resale and repair her house.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam (his wife is pictured) is married and has 2 children. He was born in 1950. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Biladjari settlement. He has run this business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy more goods to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy goods for re-sale

loans.name: Jonás

texts.en:
This young family recently purchased their first home, where they live with one child of school age. Mr. C. works in a maquiladora (a factory located in a special border free trade zone), and was able to gain access to a government program that helps low-income Mexicans to purchase a basic one room home.

He is requesting a Kiva loan in order to put a fence around the home, since as he said, "We have a young child and I'm worried about security, since there's no protection in the front of the house and the neighborhood is on the outskirts of the city."

The C. family is requesting a loan of $700.

loans.use: Construction of perimeter fence

loans.name: Mwanakheri's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Mwanakheri is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 15, 12, and 6 years old. She has been a batik, soap, and basket seller since 1998. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Mwanakheri now hopes for a loan to buy more items to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwatum.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock

loans.name: Faalili

texts.en: Faalili A., 37, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 4 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Faalili's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business and her husband will help her operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds

loans.name: Mukhtar's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtar baji is a wife of A. H.. She owns a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan, and has been living in it for the past 17 years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is in 4th standard, her second son is in 3rd standard, and her youngest son is in 2nd standard. Her daughters are free and stay at home.

Mukhtar baji’s husband is a salesman who sells candies to wholesalers. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. Mukhtar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more candies to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes four other members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. Azra baji wants a loan to buy candies to resell. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy vehicle engine oil to resell. Seema baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

loans.use: To buy candies to resell

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en: Suraiya baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in a two room brick house for the past 48 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a welding business and her younger son is a tailor. Her daughter has a thread making business. Suraiya baji’s husband is a daily wage labor. Suraiya baji has a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it in milk shops . Her monthly income is $10 to $11. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk business

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị  Phạm Thị Hoà 30 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó 2 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1997 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và lương làm thợ xây của chồng với tổng thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hoà mongmuốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm gà, vịt và thức ăn phụcvụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi H. is 30 years old. She has three children, two of whom are grown. She joined TYM Fund in 1997 to invest in livestock raising, and farming to improve her family's economy. Currently, the family's income, which comes from livestock raising and her husband's salary as a construction worker, averages at 2,500,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more chickens, ducks and animal feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a 61-year-old rice farmer and grows vegetable crops to sell. She lives in Spean Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice as a source of income to cover her expenses since 1979. With this experience, she works hard with her husband, Mr. Khon, 61 years old. S. has five children, three of whom are married; two are single. One of her children is employed as a construction worker who can help to support a part of the family and another one works farming with her.

To make her farming business easier and alleviate her physical labor, she needs a loan to purchase an ox; she will use any remainder to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase an ox and, possibly, seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his crop production

loans.name: Yolanda Orfelinda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Yolanda es viuda, tiene 50 años, tiene cuatro hijos, ya mayores,  él ultima es de 5 años y esta en la escuela estatal.
Hace 20 años empezó su negocio, despidieron del trabajo a su esposo y viajaron a  Chiclayo con su esposo donde aprendió hacer ceviche y comidas norteñas, cuando llego a Lima decidieron poner una picantería, Lamentablemente su esposo falleció hace 8 años y sus hijos mayores le ayudan en el negocio.
Yolanda necesita un crédito de 2600 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, y reparación de los baños de su local.  
Gracias a los prestamos que les dio Finca pudo salir adelante e invertir, construyó su local para su picantería,  y en los pisos siguientes hizo su casa.
El sueño de Yolanda es seguir trabajando
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will Triumph').

Yolanda is a widow, she is 50 years old and she has 4 kids who are over 18, and her last one is 5 years old and is in the state school.

She started her business 20 years ago as her husband was fired from his job and they travelled to Chiclayo with her husband where she learnt to make ceviche (a raw fish dish) and northern foods and when she arrived in Lima they decided to set up a diner. Unfortunately her husband died 8 years ago and her eldest kids help her in the business.

Yolanda needs a loan of 2600 soles to buy beer, fizzy drinks and to do some repair work to the bathrooms of her diner.

Thanks to the loans Finca has given her she was able to move forward and invest, she built a store for her diner and on the upper floors built her house.

Yolanda's dream is to keep on working.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yolanda needs a loan of 2600 soles to buy beer, fizzy drinks and to do some repair work to the bathrooms of her diner./Yolanda necesita un crédito  de 2600 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, y reparación de los baños de su local.

loans.name: Adela Natividad

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Adela es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Adela junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales y también compran ladrillos crudos que luego los queman, en sus terrenos de la comunidad de Compañía, los ladrillos los vende en la misma comunidad y también lo reparte en la ciudad de Huanta.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillo crudo.
Adela sueña con comprar un terreno en la ciudad de ayacucho para construir su casa y comprar un carro mas.
texts.en:
Adela is an associate of the Banco Comunal Nueva Era [New Era Communal Bank]. Adela is married, 43 years old, and has four children. Adela and her husband apply themselves to the fabrication of artisan bricks. They also buy raw bricks that they later fire themselves on their land in the community of Compañía. They sell the bricks within the same community and also distribute them in the city of Huanta.

Adela needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles that she would be invested in the purchase of raw bricks. Adela’s dream is to by a land in the city of Ayacucho in order to build her house and buy another car.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to buy raw bricks. / Para la compra de ladrillo crudo.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.fr:
K. Marianne est née vers 1955 à Toffo dans le Département de l'Atlantique au Sud du Bénin. Marianne est mariée et a quatre enfants avec son mari, tous scolarisés.  Marianne est Sténodactylographe de formation. Cependant, Marianne est restée dans le commerce depuis trente (30) ans; parce que c'est plus rentable. Marianne est dans la distribution de céréales et autres produits alimentaires: maïs, farine de manioc, huile végétal,etc. Marianne est aussi meunière. Marianne a son moulin à maïs chez elle et elle moud les céréales aux habitants de son quartier. Marianne a pu améliorer le niveau de son activité depuis qu'elle a fait son premier prêt à ALIDé. Ayant fini de rembourser ce premier prêt, Marianne veut un nouveau crédit pour renforcer son activité. 
  
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Marianne K. was born around 1955 in Toffo in the Atlantique province in the south of Bénin. Marianne is married and has four children with her husband, all enrolled in school.

Marianne is a trained stenographer, however, she has spent 30 years in sales because it brings in more money. She sells cereals and other foodstuffs: maize, manioc flour, vegetable oil, etc. She is also a miller; she has her maize mill at her home and she does the milling of cereals for people in her neighborhood.

Marianne has been able to make improvements to her business rsince she got her first loan with ALIDé. Having finished reimbursing that first loan, Marianne would like another loan to bolster he little business.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize, jerrycans of vegetable oil, and teeth for her maize mill

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married. She sells men's clothing at Yulana market in Pavlograd city. She has been in this business for 15 years. Her average monthly profit is 3,000 UAH. Olga would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to purchase men's sweaters for the spring season. This would help her to have a better assortment and attract more clients.

Olga's husband had several surgeries recently and now needs time and money to recover. The loan would help Olga to make additional profit and cover at least part of the recovery expenses.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ingrid Johana

texts.es: La Sr. Ingrid E. tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene 3 años de tener su negocio que esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista Centro, ella tiene muy buena clientela, el prestamo lo solicita para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio ya que entre mas productos existan las personas compran mas y asi se tienen mejores ganancias, la meta de ella es poder graduar de la universidad a sus hijas que son lo mas importante que ella tiene en esta vida.
texts.en:
Ingrid E. is a 29 year-old single mother of 2 daughters. She sells popular consumer goods for a living. She has had her business, which can be found in the Buena Vista Centro area, for 3 years. She has many good customers. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more merchandise and thereby expand her business. When she has more products, people will buy more and so she will earn a better income. Her aim is for her daughters to be able to graduate from university. They are more important to her than anything else in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tinned goods, drinks, fritters, butter, rice, beans, coffee, bread, sugar, corn, tortillas, beef, chicken and pork

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday A. is 28 years old and single without a child. He has a shop where he sells phone accessories.  He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 28, is single and a mother of two children who are in school. She lives with her children at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana.  She is a very hardworking young lady who has the responsibility of providing for her children.  She always looks up to God for help.  She sells ‘kelewele’ in the community.  Kelewele is prepared from ripe plantains chopped into very smaller pieces, wrapped with paper and fried with cooking oil. It has a good taste.  Kelewele is mostly eaten with fried groundnuts. She wants a loan to buy more ripe plantains and groundnuts to upgrade her business. She belongs to a community group called ‘Yehowa neme whefo’ which means God is my keeper.

loans.use: Buy plantain, charcoal and cooking oil etc.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 64 años, vive con su esposa Sabina y sus hijos Aldo de 17 y Fernando de 11 años en su casa propia. Junto a su esposa trabajan vendiendo carne de pollo y condimentos en un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su localidad. Como las ventas son constantes y diarias, José debe estar frecuentemente comprando mercadería, por ello quien está permanentemente atendiendo el puesto es su esposa (en la foto). Sabina es muy carismática y no hay momento que tenga libre, puesto que siempre hay clientes esperando ser atendidos, a ella le gusta mucho su negocio porque es muy rentable, pero a veces le resulta muy cansado ya que tiene que permanecer durante todo el día en su puesto. Al lado de su esposo hacen el complemento perfecto, ya que ambos tienen las mismas metas para progresar en bien de sus hijos y poderles ofrecer lo mejor. José, junto a Sabina, siempre ha trabajado con los préstamos de Microfinanzas PRISMA, este es su sexto crédito y le ha ido muy bien con su grupo, el cual es muy puntual. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de carne de pollo y condimentos para tener toda la mercadería necesaria para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old and owns his own home where he lives with his wife Sabina and his sons Aldo, 17, and Fernando 11. Together with his wife, he sells chicken and spices in a small stand in his town´s market. Because sales are continual every day, José has to buy his merchandise often, which is why his wife (in the photo) is the one who has to attend the stand. Sabina has a lot of charm and doesn´t have a free moment as there are always customers to attend to. She likes this business because it is very profitable but it is sometimes very tiring as she must be at the stand all day. She and her husband make the perfect couple; both have the same goal to get ahead for the good of their children and to be able to offer them the best. José, along with Sabina, has always worked with loans from Microfinanzas PRISMA. This is his sixth loan and he has done well with his group, who are very punctual with repayments. With the money he requests he will buy a larger quantity of chicken and spices so that he has the merchandise necessary to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Akuvi  Mawuli

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la restauration, elle fait des plats togolais et sa spécialité est le plat de FUFU fait à base d’ignames pilés, elle a dénommé son restaurant « DA VERO ». Elle s’est fait une bonne réputation dans sa zone d’activité. Elle veut se réapprovisionner en produits nécessaires à l’activité de restauration, elle sollicite alors son premier crédit pour acheter 10 tas  d’ignames, 1 sac de riz et divers produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman works in food service. She makes Togolese dishes and her specialty is a dish called "fufu" made of pounded yams. She calls her little restaurant «DA VERO». She has earned a good reputation in her line of work. She wants to replenish her stocks of the products necessary for food preparation. She is therefore requesting her first loan to buy 10 piles of yams, 1 sack of rice, and various other ingredients for her business.

She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making cooked food to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, trabaja en una empresa como consultora, tiene un hijo y es madre soltera. Su fuente de trabajo es el único ingreso que tiene para solventar los gastos de alimentación y estudios de su hijo.
Vive en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz en domicilio propio.
El crédito será destinado para el capital de inversión (pago de matricula y mensualidades de la universidad de su hijo).

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial de crédito es confiable.
texts.en:
Carmen works for a company as a consultant. She is a single mother and has one son. Her job is the only source of income to cover the cost of feeding and educating her child. She lives in her own home in the northern section of the city of La Paz.

Carmen will use her loan to pay her son’s registration fees and monthly tuition for his university studies. This is the second time she has requested a loan from IMPRO. She has a reliable credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's university tuition & registration fees

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, trading in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities and sells in her community and also supplies to other food vendors. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Nadine

texts.fr: A. Nadine est née vers 1981 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Nadine est mariée à BOKOSSA Hervé, un enseignant. Nadine et son mari ont deux enfants tous scolarisés. Nadine et sa famille vivent à Houivié depuis huit ans. C’est le mari de Nadine qui supporte les charges de la famille. C’est les friperies et le gasoil que  Nadine venddepuis environ sept ans. Nadine achète ses articles à Missèbo à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin et les vend à Djassin. Nadine a déjà eu deux d’ALIDé pour faire évoluer son activité. Nadine a bien remboursé ces crédits et elle sollicite un autre aujourd’hui pour mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Nadine was born around 1981 in  Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to BOKOSSA Hervé, a teacher. Nadine and her husband have two children who are both in school  She and her family have been living in Houivié for eight years.  She and her husband are the ones supporting the family.  Nadine has been selling second-hand clothing and diesel fuel for about seven years.  She purchases her goods in Missèbo in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She sells them in Djassin.  She has already had two ALIDé loans for advancing her business.  She repaid these loans and is today requesting another one to develop her business further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing and diesel fuel

loans.name: Ahmad Jawad Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Jawad is the group leader of Ahmad Jawad group. There are three members in this group. They would like to receive a loan for their businesses.

Ahmad Jawad requests a loan for his metal shop. Shahnaz requests a loan for a tailoring business. Shakeba requests a loan for her husband’s fruit cart business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and they want to grow their businesses.

They want to say that this loan can help them progress their businesses and make their businesses bigger. They are all thankful for the Kiva process in Afghanistan that supports poor people in this country.

loans.use: To grow their businesses (metal shop, tailoring service, fruit cart)

loans.name: Olufta

texts.ru: Юсупова Олуфта проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 41 год. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. По специальности Олуфта, "технолог", но она более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует детскими вещами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Olufta Y. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 41 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Olufta is a technologist by trade, but she has been involved in retail sales for over 12 years. She has a retail outlet at a market, where she sells children's merchandise. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Vending of snacks is what makes Precy B. busy. Precy is 23 years old and married to Eldridge Sr. They are blessed with two children: Eldridge Jr., who is 2 years old and Eliezar Daniel, who is 1 year old. The family lives in the village of Aguinaldo, Cordon.

Precy would like to buy more merchandise to be able to generate a bigger income for her family needs, especially while her children are still young and still drinking expensive milk. For this reason, Precy would like to apply for a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Kiva lenders for her business development. Precy shared with us that with the loan and with her hard work she will eventually succeed. She just hopes that the lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for vending snacks business.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 52 years old and married with six children. She sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She is also a tailor. She makes lovely designs for her customers. Her greatest joy in her business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a fashion institute in the future. This is the high season for her business and she wants to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N120,000 NGN to purchase sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Suos

texts.en: Mrs. Suos S., a longtime businesswoman who earns a living by selling distilling white wine. She resides with other family members, located in Kampong Chhnang Province. In addition, she also uses the leftover wine to raise a few pigs for extra income and typically earns $3 a day which helps her to buy food for her family. Suos S. is a married mother who has given birth to five children, one is married and four single. Two of her daughters are local tailors, while her husband, age 48, owns a machine to provide rice milling services for a profit. Suos S. is requesting a loan to purchase more tailoring materials for her daughters use to have enough supply to meet their customer’s needs.(Suos S. was not available at that time, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Yusif M. is 31 years old, married, and has two children. His wife keeps the house and takes care of their children. In order to support his family, Yusif sells household goods such as kettles, pails, pans, socks, and other items. He has been in this business for three years. Having acquired experience, Yusif is able to choose goods that meet the differing tastes of his customers. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Yusif to improve his family's living conditions and make his children happy. Today, Yusif is requesting 1,600 AZN for purchasing new household goods to enlarge his range. Be an important part of the growth of Yusif’s business!

loans.use: To enlarge his range of household goods

loans.name: Maritza Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora  Maritza E. L. es trabajadora de la fabrica de puro INAXA Estelí  ella trabaja en el área de empaque.
Maritza va utilizar el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico un equipo de sonido, ella espera que el equipo le sirva para entretenerse en los días de descanso.
Maritza es soltera y tiene tres hijo todo en edad escolar es primera vez que trabaja con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Martiza E. is a worker in the cigar factory in Estelí. She works in the packing department.

Maritza will use the loan to buy a stereo. She hopes that the stereo will entertain her on her rest days.

Maritza is single and has three children of school age, and this is the first time that she has worked with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stereo

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz O. is from the village of El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old, and single. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luz is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: Chioma sells frozen foods, other foodstuffs, and cosmetics at retail prices to her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. With these varied items, she hopes to make her business sustainable. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 90,000 to purchase more frozen foods and other foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to grow her business in the future. She is 33 years old, married to a commercial driver, and they have 4 children. Her youngest child is 3 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La Sra. Micaela vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, municipio de El torno, es casada y tiene 1 hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, su actividad es el transporte de personas, ya que conjuntamente con su esposo tienen un vehiculo, con el cual realizan su labor cotidiana, el cual es su única fuente de ingreso, para sostener a su familia, la Sra. Micaela es una persona joven responsable y trabajadora, uno de sus deseos es el de comprarse su casa propia ya que por el momento vive en alquiler. El destino del credito es para el arreglo y mantenimiento de su movilidad  

La Sra. Micaela esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Mrs. Micaela lives in Puerto Rico, in the municipality of El Torno. She is married and has 1 son that is of school age. She works in the transportation sector, with her husband, they have a vehicle and they work daily, and it is their only source of income to support the family. Mrs. Micaela is a young responsible and hardworking person, one of her wishes is to buy her own home since for now she rents. The loan will be used to repair and to maintain the vehicle.

Mrs. Micaela is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva’s field partner) and Kiva for the trust given to her by providing her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of a vehicle.

loans.name: Paula Telvia

texts.es: Paula tiene 61 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ella ha realizado con Fundación León 2000, pues estos han sido de gran apoyo. Pues ella es una persona muy ejemplar que disfruta su negocio y además que siempre ha trabajado, ella tiene muchos clientes por lo que tiene una diversidad de encargos, por lo que está muy acostumbrada a realizar este tipo de trabajos. Es por este motivo que ella solicita este financiamiento que es destinado para capital de trabajo como agujas, tijeras, hilos, tela, zipper y botones. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Paula is a 61-year-old woman who provides sewing services for a living. This is not her first loan from Fundación León 2000 as it has greatly supported her. She is an exemplary woman who loves her business. Furthermore, she has always worked. She has many customers who put in a variety of orders, so she is accustomed to all types of sewing jobs. She is requesting this loan as working capital in order to purchase needles, scissors, thread, fabric, zippers and buttons. Her wish is to be able to keep her business afloat as it is her sole means of earning a living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est une femme de 32ans et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2ans et demi. Elle a été 5 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Et est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend du riz, du sucre, de l'huile végétale etc. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle participe à la prise en charge familiale et au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Awa S. is a 32-year-old woman, mother of five children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” for two and a half years. She has received five consecutive loans and never had a problem paying them back. She has a shop where she sells rice, sugar, vegetable oil etc… With the profit she earns she contributes to cover the family’s expenses and the children’ s school fees.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and promote her activity

loans.name: R.c. Primary School, Mathan Village Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of the R.C Primary School, Mathan village, near Magburaka town in Northern Sierra Leone. This school was established in 1962. School staff from this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-year-old James F. C. is the leader of this group of teachers. Mr. C., who has been in the teaching profession for 45 years now, was born in Mayatha village. He is married and has eighteen children. With his share of the loan, James will buy house-building materials like cement and sand.

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house-building materials like cement and sand

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
O. Ikromjon is 39 years old and is married with four children. He has a café where, together with his wife, he cooks and sells national meals and foodstuffs. He has had this business for three years. Ikromjon provides fresh foodstuffs and tasty meals in his café to ensure his clients have the opportunity to eat, have a rest and can purchase what they need. His business is stable which allows him to generate significant income and to ensure his family's standard of living.

Now, Ikromjon’s children are growing and the expenses for them are also increasing. Thus, Ikromjon wants to expand his business to earn more money so he can cover his children's expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni to expand his café. By lending through Kiva, be an important part of the growth of Ikromjon’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON International's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his business to earn more income

loans.name: Reynaldo Luis

texts.es:
Reynaldo vive en la zona  Achachicala en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive junto a su familia la cual esta constituida por sus padres y hermanos. Por circunstancias de la vida y problemas familiares, se separó de su esposa con la que vivía  cuando se hizo la anterior evaluación de crédito.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de un taxi en una línea de transporte publico, en el centro de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de repuestos para la reparación del motor de su vehiculo. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives in La Paz’s Achachicala area with his family which is composed of his parents and siblings. Since the last credit evaluation was made, due to life circumstances and family problems, he separated from his wife, with whom he lived. He works driving his own taxi along a public transportation route downtown. He will use the funds to buy replacement parts for his vehicle’s motor. This is his 2nd loan with Impro and the evaluation done indicates that he is qualified for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle engine repair.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou  K. est ne dans la banlieue de Guediawaye ou il est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mars 2010. Monsieur K. est un salarie, infirmier d’état  a l’hôpital principal de Dakar. En même temps il fait des prestations de services liées  à son métier d’infirmier dans d’autres structures ou cliniques a Dakar. Il a choisi son activité par vocation. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 1 et 5 ans. Il sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs afin de  compléter son épargne  et acheter un véhicule  pour son activité de transport. La diversification de son activité est un moyen de trouver une solution au caractère  insuffisant  de son salaire et de mieux faire face a la gestion de ses besoins de sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou K. was born in the suburb of Guediawaye, where he has been a member of the loan group Baye Laye since March 2010. Mr. K. is a salaried nurse by occupation at the main hospital in Dakar. At the same time, he provides services linked to his job as a nurse at other organizations or clinics in Dakar. He chose this side business because of his training. He is married and has 2 children whose ages vary from 1 to 5 years old. He is seeking a loan of 250,000 frs in order to increase his savings and to buy a vehicle for his business transportation. The diversification of his business is a means to find a solution to the insufficiency of his salary, and to better meet and manage his familial needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en:
Nerisa O., 46, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Ulysses O., a community councilman, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Nerisa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

To ensure the success of her business, Nerisa would like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages needed to replenish and maintain her current inventory.

Nerisa dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a good and comfortable life for herself and her children.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages needed to replenish and maintain her current inventory

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa L., 48, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Bernardino L., a civilian guard, and they are blessed with six children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Luisa manages her own variety store where she also sells commodities. She also rents out a few apartment rooms.

Luisa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow twelve times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her business, Luisa would like to apply for a PHP 45,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying sacks of rice to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

Luisa dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can finally have her own stall for her business. She hopes to buy her own business space where she can maximize her income from all her businesses.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to be incorporated into her current product inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase eight sheets of zinc, seven wood beams, stone, sand and cement to start the improvements on his room

loans.name: Amalia Felicitas

texts.es: Doña Amalia es madre de 6 hijos, desde joven a prendió a trabajar en las ventas junto con su mama. Hace 10 años vende frutas y verduras que inicio con el objetivo de poder apoyar a su familia, y proporcionar a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Con los años ha logrado adquirir clientes, por lo que se siente muy contenta con este nuevo financiamiento que le será de mucha ayuda. Con este préstamo comprara productos como mangos, jocotes, naranjas, bananos y sandias  pues con una gran variedad de productos que ofrece sus clientes llegan más a frecuentemente a su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Amalia is the mother of six children. From the time she was young she has been working in sales alongside of her mother. For the past 10 years she has been selling fruits and vegetables something she started with the objective of supporting her family and providing them with the necessary income. Over the years she has accumulated many clients. She is very happy with this new funding because it will be very helpful to her work. With the loan she will buy more products like mangoes, plums, oranges, bananas, and watermelons so she can offer a greater variety of products to her clients so they come more frequently to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel wants a loan to buy a fridge for his business. He is 45 years old, married with three children. He has a retail shop which he has run for a year. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a permanent house in which he lives. Like most people in his locality, Emmanuel also nurses a dream of acquiring a maize mill to process the huge maize harvest produced in the area.

loans.use: Buying a  fridge for cooling drinks for his business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine L., 34, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Samuel L., a car air conditioner technician, and mother of three children, all of whom are already in high school. By the grace of God, Geraldine has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Geraldine as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Geraldine maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct sales brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Geraldine dreams to be able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván  N. A. es un hombre muy responsable padre de dos pequeños por quienes trabaja para ofrecerle un mejor patrimonio, hace tiempo el adquirió su vivienda de interés social pero se ve en la necesidad de impermeabilizarla ya que  en temporada de lluvia se trasmina el agua lo cual no quiere que sus muebles se vayan a deteriorar y el gasto sea mas elevado.
texts.en:
Ivan N. Alegria is a very responsible father of 2 small children, and he works hard to build up family assets for them. Some time ago he acquired a publicly subsidized housing unit, but he needs to weatherproof it, since in the rainy season the water seeps through and he doesn't want his furniture to deteriorate, which would end up costing more.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to weatherproof his home

loans.name: Rumaila's Group

texts.en:
Rumaila belongs to an industrial city of Pakistan called Faisalabad. She lives in a 2-room brick house in the area of Medina town. She moved here after her marriage with N. M. 23 years ago.

She is a housewife, prefers to stay at home and does her household work. She has given birth to 2 sons. Her eldest son is 22 years old and a tailor by profession and the younger one doesn't work.

Rumaila has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. Her husband is involved in electronics sales business. He runs a shop in the market from where he deals with electronic items with his customers and generates income for the family. With the loan amount he will buy electronic items such as irons, televisions and ovens to sell through his shop.

Rumaila is hopeful that by using his experience of 20 years in this field, her husband will successfully be able to grow his business to a level where his family can have a better standard of living. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a good step for her family’s financial future. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Rumaila.

loans.use: To buy electronic items to resell.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 43 años, es divorciado y vive con uno de sus hijos en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 15 años trabaja de manera independiente, él se dedica a las producciones musicales, cuenta con su propia banda musical presentándose en diversos eventos sociales como fiestas de graduación, matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños, etc. Su trabajo principal es el de representante de la banda, por lo que siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevos contratos que soliciten su servicio, además que también participa dentro de la banda tocando la batería electrónica. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo a lado de sus demás compañeros, para él este negocio de representaciones musicales le resulta rentable, ya que cada fin de semana nunca faltan los eventos sociales. Su deseo es mejorar su banda con instrumentos nuevos, asimismo expandir su fama por toda la región. Este es su crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, puesto que le tienen mucha confianza, por ser responsable en sus pagos; además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para mejorar el servicio en las presentaciones de su banda, ya sea gastos de estadía y el transporte de su banda.
texts.en:
Saúl, 43, is divorced and lives with one of his children in a relative’s house.  He has worked independently for the last 15 years.  He has a band and provides musical performances at various social events like graduations, weddings, baptisms, birthday parties, etc.  His main job is as the band’s agent so he is always out looking for new contracts for their services.  He’s also a band member; he plays an electronic percussion set.

He enjoys his work very much alongside his fellow band members.  For him, musical performance has turned out to be profitable because every weekend there are a lot of social events. 

He hopes to improve the band with new instruments.  This is his 10th loan with MFP and is very happy to know that he can count on financial support because he’s responsible with his repayments.  Besides, he enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive.

He thanks all those who will fund the loan he’s asking for that will be very useful for his business’ progress.

He will use the requested funds to improve his band’s presentations be it for lodging and/or band transportation costs.

loans.use: For the band's performance costs like transportation and lodging.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Mary Jane is married and has five school-age children. 

Mary Jane owns a specialized retail store where the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use and personal products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is also retailing and distributing NATASHA and AVON products.   Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Yuri; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica  al negocio de restaurante conjuntamente con su esposa, el horario de trabajo es por las tardes, con este negocio el saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio como son arroz, azúcar, verduras, menestras entre otros.   

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Sumac Puririsun communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco. 

The member is Mr. Yuri. He is 28 years old and lives with his partner and has a son. He works in the restaurant business with his wife. He works during the evenings, and with this business, he and his family are getting ahead. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase products for his restaurant, including rice, sugar, vegetables and soups, among others. 

He appreciates those that form a part of this dream, through this service, and agrees to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase products for his business, such as rice, sugar, vegetables, and soups, among others.

loans.name: Preap

texts.en:
Preap S. is a 27-year-old woman, married to Khaim Rithy, age 24, and they currently live in the province of Kompong Chhnang. This couple has one young child and earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. 

Preap S. is concerned that she needs to repair her house. Preap S. would like to request a loan which she will use to purchase material for repairing part of her house.

loans.use: To purchase material for mending part of her house.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino V. is from the village of San Ramon. He is 53 years old. Marcelino is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $594 per harvest.

In 2007, Marcelino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Marcelino is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 7th loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 31 años  de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4 años, ambos estudian en escuela y jardín de infantes. Su marido tiene un taxi amigo y es comerciante. Ella es nacida en Guayaquil pero hace seis años se vino  a vivir a  esta linda ciudad.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveres de consumo, en el que vende desde arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio por seis años y que le ha ido muy bien, los productos  compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que donde tiene su tienda es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Luz De América' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.
