Here we meet Martha who is 31 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband with whom she has two children aged 9 and 4.  Her children are in elementary school and nursery school.  Martha's husband is a taxi driver and salesman.  Martha was born in Guayaquil but six years ago she came to live in this beautiful city.

Martha has a grocery store in which she sells rice, sugar, oil and detergent and other general household items.  She works every day from 6.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later.  She tells us that she has had her business for six years and it has been very successful.  She buys some of her products in the center of Portoviejo although most of her products are delivered direct to her premises.

Martha will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other household items.  She has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and she likes it because the loans help her to keep her business running.  Martha's dream is to have her own store since her current premises are rented.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and household items

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en:
Snooky T. is from the village of Polo. She is 39 years old, married, and has fout school aged children. Snooky operates a family member's business in the food sector, selling fresh fish and other sea foods in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Snooky joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Snooky is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fresh fish to sell . This will be the 8thh loan taken out by Snooky from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: use to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is a 60-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 ventures: a general store and a pig fattening business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. Nema has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000. Nema is borrowing PHP 18,000 in order to fund business operations. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nema hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen R. D. A. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante D. granos básicos, y así mismo vive con dos hijos menores D. edad. María posee una pequeña venta D. juguetes, cosméticos, grano básicos y articulos para el hogar, los cuales comercializa en su casa D. habitación, este negocios es muy necesario para su familia, por lo que desea ampliarlo aún más. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. juguetes, cosméticos en mayor variedad y así mismo articulos para el hogar. D. esta forma María espera mejorar en gran manera sus ganancias y D. esta forma vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María Del Carmen R. D. A. is 44 years old and resides in San Juan Opico, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as a grain merchant, and their two young children. María has a small store in her home where she sells toys, cosmetics, basic grains, and household products. This business is very important to her family, so she wants to expand it even more.

María is requesting a loan that she can buy a large quantity of toys, a wiD. variety of cosmetics, and household goods. In this manner, María hopes to improve her earnings so that she and her family can live better.

loans.use: Purchase toys, cosmetics, and household goods to sell

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mississo

texts.fr: Agé de  48 ans, Monsieur  Mississo  est marié et a  2 enfants. Il exerce  comme  activité  l’extraction et la vente  de  vin  de  palme. Il s’approvisionne  dans les  palmerais et a commencé son  activité  en  2007. Il  a employé   4 personnes qui l’aident  dans  cette  activité. Il  sollicite un  prêt  pour acheter 20  palmiers.
texts.en: Mr. Mississo is a 48-year-old married man with two children. In 2007, he started extracting and selling palm wine. He gets his stocks in palm groves. He has four employees to help him in this activity. He is seeking a loan to purchase 20 palm trees.

loans.use: To buy palm trees

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce du charbon de bois et de l’essence.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                     
OUMOU B. compte acheter du riz et des condiments pour la restauration qu’elle effectue au niveau du village de Warassala, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en: The women of the Sabougnouman group, all married, are 41 years old on average, have 3 children and all live in large traditional families in the Warassala village, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through parental, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell food, charcoal, and gas.  The women of the Sabougnouman group are on their sixth group loan and all their previous loans were paid back in full.  Oumou B. expects to buy rice and spices for her food sales, which she does at the Warassala village level, for cash and credit to a customer base made up of men and women.  She plans to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA which will be used to make payments on the loan, and the rest will be re-invested in her catering business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for catering

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 35 years old, married to Elphas Rutto, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children between the ages of 12 and 6.  Hellen buys and sells milk in the Kiptamuk trading center. This has been her business for a period of eight years and she gets a monthly income of about $167.

Hellen has borrowed a loan of 65,000 KES from KADET LTD, this being her 2nd term loan after she repaid her previous loan successfully.  She intends to use the money to pay her suppliers of milk and purchase gallon containers for holding the milk.  She intends to use the profits to educate her children and purchase a plot of land for her family.

Her dream is to become a major milk supplier and also have a happy family.

loans.use: to pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy W. G. is 34 years old and married. She has been selling clothes for three years and has employed one person in her business. For extra income, Mercy also has a transport business. She was previously selling spirits and wines to earn a living.

When Mercy joined Faulu Kenya, she decided to open a saving account. This has helped her to manage her finances. Mercy has requested 20,000 KES to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Lecile

texts.en:
Lecile is 20 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for herself and her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store .

Lecile has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, bread, noodles, soft drinks, rice, etc. In the future Lecile would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Komi Vilagnon

texts.fr: Jeune père de 26 ans, Komi est marié à une revendeuse et ont un enfant.lui même est revendeur de friperie dans un quartier de lomé.il à démarré son activité en 2007 et s’approvionne à Lomé dans un marché de friperie (Hédzranawoé) et revend  à tout ceux  qui lui  font appel .toutefois il aimerait agrandir son étalage c’est pour cela qu’il nous sollicite pour ce premier crédit  pour satisfaire les besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
A young 26-year-old father, Komi is married to a retailer and together they have a child. He is a retailer of used clothing in one of the Lomé neighborhoods. He began this business in 2007 and obtains his supplies in Lomé at a market for used clothes (Hédzranawoé), re-selling to anyone who may need him.

He would like to expand his display area , and this is the reason for asking us for this first loan in order to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Ofelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods and home cleaning supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ofelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods and home cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she is raising three daughters and a son. The two older daughters study at school and the other children are preschool age (under seven).  In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, Ainura cultivates agricultural products and also breeds livestock.

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock in order to resell it at a higher price after being fattened. In the near future, with money gained from reselling livestock, Ainura wants to start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Akhouryan. She is the proud mother of five children - three sons (nineteen, twenty-six and twenty-seven years old) and two daughters (nine and twenty-four years old). Working on the family farm since high school Susanna has been able to support her family.  Being a lifelong resident of Akhuryan she would like to continue to expand her business.  Susanna is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  She would also like to repair the cattle shed.  According to her business plan this investment will increase the family income by fifteen percent.  With the additional income Susanna will continue to grow the business and save money for her youngest daughter and son to attend university.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Mila has a shop that buy and sells gold dust. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 23,000 to buy gold dust & sell it in bulk. 

Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gold dust and sell it in bulk.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a hardworking 32-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children who are 12, 4, and 1 years old. He has been operating a retail shop for the last seven years to meet the needs of his family. He supplements his income from the earnings he makes from his barber shop. He wants, in the next five years, to have transformed his business into a wholesale one, which is also his dream. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase maize flour, rice, sugar, kerosene etc. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to form and join a helpful group with like-minded entrepreneurs and to think objectively in his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, sugar, kerosene etc

loans.name: Lunsar Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Lunsar” group from Lunsar, northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Yeabu is the leader of this group. The 49-year-old woman is married to a businessman and the couple has four children. Yeabu has been a businesswoman for 20 years now. She sells fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy about three or four cartons of fresh fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy three or four cartons of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Marcia Lindaura

texts.es:
La señora Marcia se dedica a la venta de alimento balanceado para animales bovinos y porcino, se dedica a esta actividad  desde hace  dos años, su esposo es el encargado de realizar varios viajes y buscar mercados junto con su esposa para la comercialización del producto,  tiene  5 hijos de los cuales estudian en colegio,  adicionalmente a esta actividad la señora Marcia esta empezando con la cría  de pollos parrilleros para la venta sus hijos les ayudan a contribuir en este negocio La señora cuenta  con condiciones precarias para el almacenamiento de su productos y solicita el crédito para la construcción de un tinglado (silo Un silo es una estructura diseñada para almacenar grano y otros materiales a 
granel; son parte integrante del ciclo de acopio de la agricultura) para que no se les desperdicie el producto, ya que tuvo malas experiencias con las lluvias, es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcia sells balanced animal feed for cattle and pigs. She has been in this business for two years. Her husband is in charge of making several trips and searching for markets, while she is in charge of selling the product. They have five children who are in school. In addition to this business, Sra. Marcia began raising broiler chickens to sell. Her children help with this business.

Sra. Marcia has inadequate conditions for storing her products, so she is requesting a loan in order to build a silo (a structure designed for storing grain or granular materials, which is essential in farming as part of the harvesting cycle). She does not want any of her product to go to waste because she has had bad experiences caused by the rains. Marcia is a hardworking individual.

loans.use: to build a silo for storing animal feed.

loans.name: Gabriela Elitania

texts.es: Gabriela tiene 41 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales uno estudia la secundaria y el otro la primaria, ella se dedica a vender ropa para dama y bolsas desde hace 5 años dice que emprendió su negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y para ayudar en la educación de sus hijos. Gaby como de cariño le dicen vende la ropa que compra a sus amigas y conocidas en pagos ya que así ella les da la felicidad de pagar y así le compran mas ropa y bolsas, dice que esta pidiendo el crédito para invertirlo en mercancía como pants, chamarras, pantalones de mezclilla, blusas etc. Gaby ira a la ciudad de Moroleón Guanajuato a surtir su ropa ya que aya le dan buenos precios y así ella le puede ganar algo a su ropa, dice que su negocio le agrada por que no es pesado ya que tiene tiempo para tender a su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 41 years old, married, and has two children. One child is a high school student and the other attends elementary school. Gabriela has been selling women’s clothing and handbags for five years. She says that she started this business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and pay for their children’s education.

With great affection, Gaby says that she sells clothes to her friends and acquaintances who pay her in installments. They are happy to pay for this merchandise and buy more clothing and handbags. Gaby says she is asking for a loan to invest in merchandise such as trousers, jackets, jeans, blouses, and other items. She goes to the city of Moroleón Guanajuato so that she can restock on clothing at good prices. This allows her to earn some profit. Gaby says she likes her business because the workload is not heavy and she has time to spend with her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, jackets, jeans, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Gloria Alba

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4  años  y la menor de 7 meses,  el mayor  estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Nuestra amiga junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos para ganarse el sustento diario y el de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de varios artículos de primera necesidad, productos plásticos, legumbres y frutas, nos cuenta que se desplazan en su carro  hasta otros cantones y parroquias ofreciendo sus productos en las ferias de estos lugares ya que en estos días es cuando más personas salen de los campos y compran sus productos. Ellos llevan más de 5 años dedicados  a esta actividad y les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar productos plásticos, papel higiénico, aceites, detergentes, frutas, legumbres, etc. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Sus sueños son comprar otro carro y  tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres De Lucha” Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for being very commercial, for the traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals and for the happiness of its residents. 

Gloria lives in this area. She is 22 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage. She has two children with her partner who are four years old and less than seven months old. The older child is in school. Her husband is a salesman. 

With her husband, our friend, Gloria, works in sales in order the support themselves and their children daily. They sell various basic necessity products like plastic products, vegetables and fruits. She tells us that they travel in their vehicle to other cantons and parishes selling their products in the fairs in the area. On fair days, more people come from the country and purchase their products. They have had this business for more than five years and have done well with it. 

This loan will be used to purchase plastic products, toilet paper, oils, detergents, fruits, vegetables and other items. Gloria has been with the Communal Bank for two cycles. She likes the bank because the loans are quick and they do not have many requirements. 

Her dream is to purchase another car and to have a grocery store.

loans.use: buy plastic products, toilet paper, oils, detergents, fruits, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Ricardo provides Internet and computer games where customers spend a single peso per minute. He has had this business for six years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for electricity and for maintenance.

Ricardo is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ricardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for electricity and for maintenance.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 29-year-old, single woman who opened a cafeteria three years ago to make her living. She sells coffee, tea, and hot chocolate, in addition to special fresh juices, biscuits, nuts, chocolates, and chips.

Heba is working hard to improve her business. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase her business capital by buying big quantities of tobacco, drinks, and snacks with good prices for the winter season.

Heba is already an Al Majmoua borrower, and her previous loan helped a lot in improving her business. She hopes this loan will also have a positive effect.  

Heba is expert in this field, since she used to work in a café before she started her own business. Most of her customers are her neighboring villagers. She hopes to expand her business more and more and to start providing a delivery service for her customers.

loans.use: to increase her business capital by buying more stock for good prices for the winter season.

loans.name: Cape Of Hope Group

texts.en:
Getrude, 49, is a hardworking woman, who is married with four children aged 28, 26, 22 and 15. She lives in Shurugwi, a small town near Gweru, the capital of the Midlands Province. Her spouse works for Zimasco Company in Shurugwi as an accountant.

She is in the business of raising chicken and also buys bundles of second-hand clothes for resale. She also sells cakes and samosas. She is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase day-old chicks and chicken feed.  The additional income derived from her business will enhance the quality of life of her family.

In the future, she plans to open a general store.

loans.use: To buy at least 1,000 chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 42 years old and is the mother of four school-going children. For the past six years, she has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. Besides farming, she also runs a retail business in the area. Veronica was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this will be her first loan.  

Veronica is requesting a loan to buy more stock for her retail business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to earn more income and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru: Гафур 11 лет занимается  откормом скота. У него большая семья он отец троих детей и заботливый муж. Он старается создать хорошие условия для семьи. В настоящее время он имеет 5 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он хочет получить займ в размере 5000 сомони для приобретения дополнительного скота и корма для них. Он уверен, что вы его поддержите и он получит займ. Он заранее благодарен вам в поддержке.
texts.en: Gafur has been involved in fattening up livestock for 11 years.  He has a large family, is a father of three children and is a caring husband.  He tries to provide all of the necessary conditions for his family.  Currently, he has five heads of cattle.  Gafur wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 somoni to purchase additional livestock and fodder.  He is certain that you will support him and that he will get this loan.  He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
This is Nilda, age 58, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Magdalino, a driver. She is a mother of one child. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nilda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small quantity of cooking oil or an egg. She earns a living by buying supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nilda dreams of being able to give all her family a good future through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas De Los Bajos se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 24 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y de 1 año de edad, el mayor esta en jardín de infantes. El marido es ebanista. 

Ella trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad pero también se dedica a la venta productos de Avon, y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja los fines de  semana en sus ventas y de lunes a viernes por las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a alguna de sus clientes que trabajan durante el dia,  deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente,  lleva 2 años dedicada a esta labor.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal dos ciclos y le gusta por la unión del grupo.
 
Su meta es terminar de construir  su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank group called Mujeres Unidas de los Bajos get together twice a month in the city of Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and for its handicrafts such as the straw hats known inside and outside the country.

In this place lives Patricia, who is 24 years old. She lives with a partner and from this union she has two children who are 5 and 1 year of age. The older child is in kindergarten. Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

She works in a local factory but she also sells Avon products, and Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She works on the weekends and during the evenings from Monday to Friday on her sales because this is the time she can find some of her customers, since they work during the day. She leaves her products on credit and she collects payment once a week. She has been doing this for 2 years.

She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams. This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the unity of the group.

Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 44-year-old, married father of nine. His seven youngest children are minors and attend school. Samwel has been farming for 15 years, and he currently has a farm where milk and tea are his main products.

Samwel has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, his second from the organization. He believes that the income will enable him to educate his children. He adds that his focus is to raise purebreds.

Samwel laments his business challenges, which include the unreliable artificial insemination services provided in the area as well as rampant diseases.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, ages 16 and 19. Her husband works as a carpenter and farmer.

Cecilia makes roofing materials from dried nipa leaves. She has been selling nipa roofing to her community for three years. Cecilia earns 5000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase more nipa leaves to make roofing materials. Cecilia hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa leaves to make roofing materials.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es: La señora Luz Amparo con sus 48 años se encuentra separada de su esposo y ha quedado a cargo de sus dos hijos. Tiene una mente emprendedora, lo que le ha permitido continuar con el negocio familiar de la venta de obleas (snacks) y ha logrado expandirlo hasta vender hacia otros municipios de Antioquia. Busca incrementar la capacidad productiva de su negocio, pues la demanda de su producto es mayor a la que puede atender, por lo que requiere de la compra de 10 planchas más que le permitan incrementar su producción y aumentar sus ventas. De este modo, busca brindarles a sus dos hijos la educación que requieren, y permitirles progresar en un futuro.
texts.en: Señora Luz Amparo, aged 48, is separated from her husband and is in charge of their two children. She has an entrepreneurial spirit, which has allowed her to continue the family business selling wafers (snacks). She could expand it and is now selling wafers in other municipalities of Antioquia. She seeks to expand the production capacity of her business, because her customers want to buy more wafers than she can produce. This is why she needs to buy an additional 10 hotplates to increase her production and sales. Thus she will be able to provide needed education to her two children and ensure their successful future.

loans.use: to buy an additional 10 hotplates for the production of wafers (snacks).

loans.name: Damaris De La Cruz

texts.es:
La joven Damaris de la Cruz, es comerciante de venta de ropa desde hace 2 años en unos de los Mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Chinandega, inicia sus labores a las 8:00 am llegando a su puesto de trabajo a las 8:30 am preparando y arreglando sus productos que ofertará de forma ambulante a su clientela finalizándola a las 12:00 pm, negocio con  el cual logra brindar el sustento diario a sus 2 hijos ya que es madre soltera, la joven viaja a Managua 2 veces por semana a realizar compras de mercadería al por mayor permitiendo obtenerlas a un precio más favorable. 

La joven Damaris solicito el crédito a Ceprodel  el cual fue  utilizado para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisetas, camisas, blusas, licras, ropa interior para ambos sexos, que servirá para mejorar los ingresos y su inventario con productos nuevos dándoles un mejor bienestar a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris de la Cruz has been a clothing merchant for two years in one of Chinandega’s busiest markets.  She starts her work day at 8am arriving at her sales stand at 8:30 to arrange the goods that she’ll sell to her customers until noon.  She’s able to support her two children with this business since she’s a single mother.  She travels to Managua twice a week to buy merchandise at wholesale thus getting them at a better price.

Damaris asked Ceprodel for a loan that she used to buy products like pants, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, Lycra, underwear for both genders that will help her increase income and inventory with new products to provide better well-being for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a Kenyan woman. She is a housewife who is loving and is protective of her family. After finishing house chores, she works on her farm and does all this is because she wants to improve her family's living conditions, to show progress, and to give her four children the opportunity to study and prepare themselves for life in a good way. She also does some side hustle business. Florence has been farming for the past 10 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and crops. Florence is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by buying seeds so that she can plant them and sell them after harvesting. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy farm implements such as seeds. Kenya's Maguncha, Kenyenya area one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for food. This means that Florence could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. She now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with the wonderful KIVA lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Florence believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for food. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Florence to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.
Be inspired and support a farmer who wants to progress!

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Chebiemit village who is involved in dairy and maize/corn farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. She gets help with the work from her family members. 

Pauline is seeking a loan to purchase quality farm inputs. Through your loan investment in her business, Pauline will use the money to buy important supplies such as herbicides and pesticides to manage weeds and preserve the harvested produce. She also plans to use part of the money to pay laborers, loaders and transporters. 

Pauline is optimistic that this years harvest will be better than last season's. Income from the dairy will be used to make initial loan repayments until the crops are harvested and sold.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works as a saleswoman. Her main products are shoes and perfume. She learned how to sell by watching her mother who would bring her along when she would go out and sell clothes. She started off by selling lingerie to her close friends and now has moved on to other products. She needs the loan in order to buy her merchandise from wholesalers at better prices. She wants to invest in active wear now that the hottest months are approaching (January – April is the summer season).

Bella is 29 years old and has 2 children. Her biggest aspiration is to be able to giver her kids a complete education. With the extra profits she will help her husband with the construction costs of their new home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to buy her merchandise from wholesalers at better price

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: This will be Olga P.'s second loan from Microinvest.  Her first loan was for $300 to purchase seeds and material for her land.  She harvested last year's crop which consisted of corn, potatoes and sunflowers to sell the seeds and to make into oil and cabbage which all generated enough profit for her to pay off her loan.   She was so proud of her success from her first loan and how well she prospered after taking a small loan that she is eager to take out a larger loan to buy some piglets, to raise and sell at the local market. She is 45 years old, with four children, two girls, 2 and 16 years old and two boys 7 and 20 years old.  The picture is of Olga holding up the contract to start the process of obtaining a loan through Microinvest.

loans.use: To purchase some piglets

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is married with four children all in primary school. She has not undertaken any formal training.  She has been in the business for thirteen years, and gets her stock of fish directly from the fishermen.  With a loan from PEMCI, Leah wishes to increase her stock, which had gone down, in order to meet the demands of her customers. Through her business, she has been able to uplift the welfare of her family, and buy herself a piece of land and a dairy cow.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Genaro Teofilo

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Genaro Teofilo has a general store where he sells items needed for everyday use, as well as canned goods and groceries. He has been in business for two years. So far, business has been very good because he treats his clients very well, and because he offers products that are always fresh and high quality.

Loan Use

Mr. Teofilo needs this loan to buy a copy machine because in his area nobody is offering this service. He would also like to improve the outside of his shop. He would like to better promote this business to attract more clients.

Personal Information

Mr. Teofilo is 37 years old and has two children, one of whom is a student. They live in a basic, cement house, and he has a close, stable family. He also hopes to finish the construction of his house, so that he would have some space to rent out as the area he's in is very commercial.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Teofilo tiene una despensa donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y víveres. Este negocio lo tiene hace dos años. Actualmente le ha ido muy bien pues tiene buena manera de tratar a los clientes y se esmera porque sus productos sean frescos y de buena calidad.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Teofilo necesita el crédito para comprar una copiadora por que en su sector nadie presta ese servicio y además quiere mejorar la fachada de su local ya que tiene pensado hacer una publicidad mas llamativa para tener mas clientela.

Información Personal

El tiene 37 años y dos hijos de los cuales uno estudia, su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Una de sus metas es de poder terminar de construir su casa y así tener locales para alquilar por que el esta en una zona muy comercia

loans.use: For investment in a second hand copy machine

loans.name: Mamapo

texts.en: Mamapo, an unmarried mother of Samatau, is pictured here with the products she sells for a living. Through help from SPBD, she was able to get a loan of 750.00 tala (about US$ 280) to start a small business selling chips and ice cakes from her home. She looks very happy here as she goes through a typical day, selling her homemade goods for a living. She is thankful for SPBD’s assistance that has allowed her the chance to sell goods for a living.

loans.use: For store supplies

loans.name: Lucilo

texts.en:
Mr. Lucilo Caceres is 61 years old and married with two children. He lives with his wife Elodia Araujo in Itacuribí, Paraguay. Together they run two separate businesses. One of their businesses is a shop that makes and sells ice cream and the other is a laundry business.

Lucilo has had these businesses for the past 15 years. From past experience, Lucilo and his wife have much more work in the summer than during other times of the year. Due to the sweltering temperatures in Paraguay, ice cream is in high demand. During the summer months, which Paraguay is now entering, Lucilo must produce a much larger quantity of ice cream to meet consumer demands. The laundry also requires work but less so than the ice cream parlor. The laundry is almost automated, as Lucilo and Elodia own four washing machines and two driers.

The loan they have requested will go toward building another small salon in which they can make more ice cream. In this way they will be able to better serve their clients at the ice cream parlor. With the laundry they have already established fixed weekly customers and are less concerned about growth in this respect. With the money they earn from both endeavors they are able to maintain their family and put their two children through college.

loans.use: To build an ice cream salon

loans.name: Victoria Zenina's Group

texts.es:
Victoria, Adaliz and Apolonia are members of the Comunal Spring Bank. They have different stories: Apolonia sells sweets in the center of the city of Ayacucho, she started this business 35 years ago when she was very young, Adaliz sells groceries out of her house and on Sundays she sells new and used shoes at the San Juan Bautista market. And Victoria sells clothes upon request and offering them to her friends and family, she started her business 6 years ago. The loans are of 1600 soles, 1200 soles and 600 soles, that will be invested in the purchase of cookies, chocolates, cigarettes, gum, new and used shoes, rice, sugar, soft drinks, milk, noodles, and kids clothing. They hope to better their businesses day to day and have more goals like going to the markets and having a shoe factory. Their dreams are to have their own shoe store and that their children finish their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria, Adaliz y Apolonia son integrantes del Banco Comunal Primavera. Ellas tienen diferentes negocios: Apolonia venD. golosinas en el centro D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, este negocio lo realiza hace 35 años desD. que era muy joven, Adaliz venD. abarrotes en su casa y los días domingos venD. zapatos usados y nuevos en la feria D. San Juan Bautista y Victoria venD. ropa a pedido y ofreciendo a sus amigas y familiares, negocio que realiza desD. hace 6 años. Sus préstamos son D. 1600 soles, 1200 soles y 600 soles, que invertirán en la compra D. galletas, chocolates, cigarro, chicles, zapatos nuevos y usados, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, leche, fideo, chompas, ropa D. bebe. Ellas esperan mejorar su negocio día a día y tienen más metas como ir a las ferias y tener una fabrica D. zapatos. Sus sueños son tener una tienda propia D. zapatos, tener una zapatería y que sus hijas terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.

loans.use: The loans are of 1600 soles, 1200 soles and 600 soles, that would be invested in the purchase of cookies, chocolates, cigarettes, gums, new and used shoes, rice, sugar, soft drinks, milk, noodles, and baby clothing.

loans.name: Nansana 7/8 2037 (D) Group

texts.en: Sauda runs a charcoal business. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mahsat

texts.en: Mahsat J. is 47 years old, she lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan, she is married, and she has 6 children. Her family has experienced financial problems, so does her best to improve her family's well-being. Therefore, she works extremely hard and trades her goods (beauty supplies and perfumes such as hair dyes/tints, creams, shampoo, soaps, scents, etc.) near the flea bazaar. Now Mrs. J. seeks a loan of 1100 TJS ($325) to purchase additional goods.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang S. is widow with two daughters, one of whom is married and lives outside family home. The other one lives with her and helps in selling grocery items. The family lives on a Mekong River island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Leang started selling grocery items in 1993. She buys the products from the market in Phnom Penh for re-sale at her home. She is requesting a loan for the eighth time in the amount of $500 to repair her house.

loans.use: repairing their house

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 48 years old and is a married woman with one child, age 17 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other child, age 2 years old. Mwanhamis owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Everyday she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Dei Edth Kaoh Phos Iv Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are 14 members in the Dei Edth Kaoh Phos IV Village Bank. Mr. Chhuon R. is the Village Bank President. He makes white wine and breeds pigs in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos Village in Kandal Province. He has asked for a loan to buy pig food. He is 55 and the father of five children; one of them is a pig breeder while the other four help their father make white wine. His wife, Sareourn Keot, assists her husband’s business. The family incoM. usually is spent on food, wedding ceremonies and funerals. Last year, Mr. Chhuon R.’s pig faced disease and died.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Mr. M. is a single man who lives in the Som neighborhood in Thies with his parents. His business consists of the purchase and retail sale of spare parts. With this loan, he would like to purchase a large quantity of products to increase his supplies in order to better satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr M. est un celibataire qui vit au quartier SOM à THIES chez ses parents. Son activité principale consiste à acheter et revendre au détail des pièces détachées. Avec ce pret il veut acheter des marchandises en quantité pour renforcer son stock pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare parts

loans.name: Enogionmwan

texts.en: Enogionmwan I. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City. She started this business of selling female clothes in 2003. She learned this business by herself. Enogionmwan is a LAPO client. She is requesting the loan amount of $875 to buy more female clothes, shoes, and wrappers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes, shoes, and wrappers for sale

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.en:
M. Asatullo is 25 years old. He is married. Asatullo uses his car to provide a taxi service. He has been in this business for the past three years. This business is the main source of income for his large family. 

Asatullo works hard. He gets up early and goes to bed late, trying not to miss any clients. Asatullo is trying to provide high quality service and attractive prices for his customers. 

To lower his fuel costs and reduce the fees for his services, Asatullo is planning to replace the fuel supply system in his car with a system that uses gas. For this purpose, he requests $500 USD for a term of 12 months. This is a first loan for Asatullo. He thanks everyone for their trust and support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a kapron gas cylinder for the fuel supply system.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam started selling the most basic construction materials (cement, gravel, and sand) retail in a room in her house. Today she has constructed a location that is better supplied. She now also sells electrical materials, plumbing such as PVC pipes, and hardware. She now sales wholesale.

Thanks to the profits this has given her, she has been able to expand and have a stable business.

She needs a loan of $400, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy assorted merchandise. She has every hope that with Kiva's support, she can obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Miriam inicio vendiendo solo lo más básico para la construcción (cemento, grava, arena) en menudeo, en un cuarto de su vivienda. Hoy en día ya construyo un local, lo acondiciono, ya tiene mas surtido, ahora también vende material eléctrico, plomería desde tubos pvc hasta tornilleria, y ya vende a mayoreo.

Gracias a las ganancias que esto le ha dejado se ha podido ampliar y tener un negocio ya estable.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara a 6 meses, para la compra de surtido de mercancía, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Iaeli

texts.en:
Iaeli L. is 62 years old and married with eight children. She has two years of experience selling 'elei,' traditional Samoan printed cloth. She sells her clothing in her village and to the public six days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~$83 USD).

Iaeli has benefited from one previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loan. SPBD loans are Iaeli's only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her clothing business by purchasing fabric, materials, needles, paints, and brushes.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, materials, needles, paints, and brushes to create 'elei', traditional Somoan print clothing.

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab H. has been selling clothes and snacks in Zanzibar for 2 years. She works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM every day and earns a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell and more flour. She needs the flour because it is a main ingredient in the snacks that she sells outside of her shop.

Zainab is 24 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more flour and clothing

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: IBRAHIMA est agé de 42 ans ,il est marié et pére de famille .son activité principale est le commerce de detail qu 'il exerce depuis deux (2) ans dans un quartier de mbour.Avec le pret sollicité il compte renforcer son commerce par la diversification des produits.
texts.en:
Imbrahima is 42 years old, married and a father. For two years he has been working mainly as a retailer in a neighborhood of Mbour. He plans to use this loan to strengthen his business by stocking a wider selection of products.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Najjanakumbi A- Barbra Group

texts.en:
Barbra N. is friendly and seems hard-working. She sells agricultural produce like maize, beans, millet, sorghum, soya beans, and groundnuts in Najjanakumbi where she rents a stall at the rate of Ush 120,000 per month. On average, Barbra sells goods worth Ush 200,000 per week from which she earns a weekly profit of Ush 60,000. She is using this loan to purchase more cereals, especially maize, beans, groundnuts, and millet. She has also made some advance payments to upcountry suppliers.

Barbra is a married mother of 4 children. In addition, she cares for 7 orphaned children. With the responsibilities at hand, she dreams of opening up a wholesale retail shop in the city, hoping that it will earn her more income as compared to the present business. With increased profits, she would love to see these 11 children through school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase more cereals, especially maize, beans, groundnuts, and millet

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty Y., thirty- four, is married with four children. Two of her children are in senior high school while the other two are in junior high school. Gifty says her husband’s business is not booming now. As a result, she works very hard to help provide for the family and most importantly, to pay the children’s school fees.

Gifty sells varieties of drinks and mineral water both in bottles and also in cans. She doesn’t own a store and so hawks her products door-to-door and in people’s work places. She desires to distribute the mineral water in crates to retailers. She therefore wants a loan to achieve this. She procures the drinks from retailers in her community. She wants to procure them directly from the manufacturers in Kumasi where the cost is economical.

loans.use: To buy crates of mineral water

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Lucia C. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 12 and 25 years old. Lucia has been running a grains business since 1998. Her business is selling grain. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lucia currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more grain and then resell it to customers. Lucia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more grain for resale

loans.name: Epifanía

texts.es:
Epifanía tiene veintiocho años y a parte de su negocio, se dedica a la crianza de su único hijo de cinco años. Dentro de poco gozará también del nacimiento de su segundo hijo, por lo que por ahora no puede hacer mucho esfuerzo en su trabajo, aunque eso no le impide continuar con sus labores diarias.
Hace diez años que se vende verduras en el mercado, contando con un puesto propio. Epifanía cuenta siempre haber trabajado en este rubro. El puesto tiene en total tiene veinte años. Al inicio lo manejaba su mamá, mientras ella la ayudaba, pero se la mamá se lo dejó a ella ya que regreso a su pueblo natal.
En un tiempo futuro, quisiera agrandar su puesto para que el negocio progrese. Con las ganancias de su trabajo cubre los gastos de su casa junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Epifanía is 28 years old, and apart from her business, she spends her time raising her five-year-old son. In a short time, she will welcome her second child into the world. Because of this, she cannot put too much effort into her job at the moment, but it doesn't impede her carrying on with her daily chores. For the past 10 years, she has sold vegetables in the market from a post she owned herself. Epifanía has always worked in this field. The post is now 20 years old. In the beginning, her mother managed it while Epifanía helped, but she left it to Epifanía when she returned to the village where she was born. In the future, she would like to expand the post so the business will advance. Her earnings, along with her husband's, cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 34 años de edad, vive con sus 2 menores hijos y su esposo, quienes la apoyan en todo lo necesario. La casa donde viven es propia, como resultado del esfuerzo de su trabajo. Se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches en las afuera de su casa, además, junto con su esposo tiene una tienda de repuestos, este negocio también lo implementó en su casa. Ambas actividades las realiza desde hace 8 años, por una temporada dejó la venta de comida, pero luego se dio cuenta que se aburría, y comenzó nuevamente con el negocio. Es por ello que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que se mantiene ocupada, ya que se considera una mujer muy activa, y está contenta porque ambos negocios le son rentables y complementan los ingresos en su hogar. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, el dinero que está solicitando es para incrementar la mercadería de su tienda de repuestos. Sandra comenta que estos artículos son muy costosos, cuando invierte en mercadería, muchas veces le alcanza para una o dos cajas de algún material.
texts.en:
Sandra is 34 year old and lives with her 2 small children and husband, who depend on her for everything. They live in their own house which is a result of her work efforts. At night she sells food outside of her home and, together with her husband, she also has a spare parts store, a business also started in her home. They have had both businesses for 8 years but for a short while she left the food business. She soon realized she was becoming bored and started the business again. It is for this reason she likes her work, it keeps her busy since she considers herself a very active woman. She is happy because both businesses are profitable and complement the household income. This is her second loan with MFP. The money she is requesting is to increase the merchandise of her spare parts store. Sandra states that, when investing in merchandise, these articles are very expensive, often enough for one or two boxes of materials.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou Mané est une dame de 70 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle s’active dans la vente de thé, sucre, huile. En même temps, elle va acheter 4 bœufs, qu’elle va élever un moment avant de les revendre. Ses revenus vont lui permettre de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Salimatou Mané is a 70-year-old lady, married with 3 children for whom she is responsible. She sells tea, sugar and oil. At the same time, she is going to buy 4 cows that she will raise for a while before re-selling them. Her income allows her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of sugar, oil, and tea and raising cattle

loans.name: Kamol

texts.ru: Камол работает частным строителем. Недавно ему исполнилось 50 лет, он женат. По меркам региона, где он проживае,т он считается многодетным отцом, так как у него 5 детей. Старшие закончили школу и уже зарабатывают. Семья большая и поэтому дополнительно камол занимается куплей продажей скота на рынках. Ему помогает его старший сын. Если не получается продать скот на рынке Камол приводит его домой и в течении недели смотрит за ним. На следующем рынке он продает а прибыль тратит на семью. Камол подал заявку на КИВА и собирается немного расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Kamol is a private construction worker. He has recently turned fifty. Kamol is married with 5 children. By the standards of his region, he has many children. His elder children already finished school and earn their own living. To support his large family, Kamol sells cattle, and his eldest helps him do that. If Kamol does not manage to sell the cattle at the market, he brings it home and tends to it for about a week before he takes it to another market. The profit from cattle sales goes to support the family. Kamol applied for a Kiva loan in order to be able to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Arfeh

texts.en:
Mr. Arfeh A. is dedicated to his business of selling chicken, and it has been the only source of income for supporting his family. He has a wife and three children.

He has now asked Ryada for credit so that he can buy chicken to sell at the market, thereby continuing to improve the economic conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for sale at market

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Хобилова Дилафруз молодая женщина , предприниматель , которая продаёт в аптеке разнообразные лекарства и медикаменты. Она живёт и торгует в Костакозе, товар покупает с Истаравшана , а также привозит Российская фирма.  Дилафруз планирует на полученный кредит пополнить заканчивающиеся медикаменты.
texts.en:
Dilafruz Hobilova is a young woman, an entrepreneur, who sells different medicines and medical supplies at a pharmacy. She lives and sells in Kostakoz and purchases her products in Istaravshan and her products are also brought by a Russian firm. Dilafruz plans to use the loan to purchase medical supplies that are running out.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine sales

loans.name: Cristo Viene Group

texts.es: Hace más dos años, quince mujeres conforman la asociación “Cristo Viene”, están convencidas, que con una actividad propia pueden mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. La mayoría de ellas viven en la zona Villa Exaltación, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, venden cosméticos por catalogo, ropa, confeccionan polleras (Una pollera es una falda larga usada como vestimenta femenina, típica en algunas regiones de Bolivia), centros de polleras  y mantillas, otras de las socias elaboran y venden almuerzos  y otras meriendas en mercados de la ciudad. La asociación Cristo viene,  desea aumentar sus ventas, para esto necesita comprar insumos y/o productos y así  poder obtener mayores ganancias
texts.en:
Over two years ago, fifteen women formed the association “Cristo Viene” (“Christ is Coming”); they are convinced that by carrying out their own activities they can improve the quality of life of the families. The majority of the members live in the zone Villa Exaltación, located in the city of El Alto. They carry our various activities, such as, selling cosmetics by catalog, clothing, and making ‘polleras’ (A pollera is a traditional long skirt worn by women in some regions of Bolivia), ‘pollera’ underskirts, mantillas (head scarves), while other members make and sell lunches and other meals in the city’s market. The association “Cristo Viene” would like to increase their sales and for this they need to purchase supplies and/or products to be able to gain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and/or products.

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira Leonor G. V. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 1 hija de 32 años de edad, quien no depende económicamente de ella.
Edelmira se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro mas cajas de cerveza.
Este crédito de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mesas para implementar un pequeño restaurant en su casa para la venta de piqueos y también comprará cerveza.  Con este crédito podrá adecuar un ambiente en su domicilio. Edelmira sueña con tener un bar y restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edelmira Leonor G. V. is 56 years old, and she lives in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad, Perú. This businesswoman has completed school until the fifth year of secondary school. She has a 32-year-old daughter, who is not financially dependent on her. Edelmira sells beer in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought more boxes of beer. This loan of 1500 soles will be invested to buy tables so that she can have a small restaurant in her house, where she will sell snacks. She will also buy beer with the loan. With this loan, she will be able to have a good setting in her house for a restaurant. Edelmira dreams of having a bar and restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have a restaurant and to buy beer

loans.name: Nurchamol

texts.ru: Нурчамол Джураева проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 40 лет. Женат имеет 6 детей. Нурчамол вместе с мужем занимается сельским хозяйством. Она в основном выращивает арбуз и помидоры и продает его на рынке. Кредит просит для посева урожая. На полученную прибыль хочет купить крупно рогатый  скот.
texts.en:
Nurchamol D. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Nurchamol and her husband are involved in agriculture. She primarily grows watermelons and tomatoes and sells them at a market. Nurchamol is requesting a loan for harvesting and sowing. She wants to use resulting profits to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and sowing

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
el señor Abel B. R. es mayor de edad, casado, tiene 42 años y vive en la colonia San Franciso en San Lorenzo, Valle. 
el tiene 8 años de dedicarse ala compra y venta de helados, su compañera de hogar es Eva Nuñez con quien ha procreado 3 hijos.
el vende de todo tipo de helados como ser paletas rellenas, conos, vasitos, capuchinos, este porducto lo mantiene en su casa en un  frezer y el tiene una carreta para venderlo ambulantemente, sale a vender a diferentes barrios y colonias.
es esta ciudad se vende mucho las paletas y el ice cream ya que es una ciudad puerto y esta pegada al mar, hace mucha calor en esa zona.
el necesita el credito para comprar algunos productos que sus clientes le piden, pero a veces el no los tiene por falta de dinero para comprarlos.
su sueño es tener varias carretas de paletas. asi mismo contribuir con empleos a mas personas.

loans.use: compra de paletas, conos, vasitos de ice cream,

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is thirty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a daughter, who is in school. As a single parent, Anna works very hard to be able to provide for her family. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Anna is a trader. She runs a provision store located by the roadside in her community. She procures her inventory from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter W. is a 36-year-old man, married to Serah Wambui, and together they have two children ages 5 and 7 years old.For the last three years, Peter has been baking and supplying cakes within Naivasha town, using a motorbike for transport. He joined KADET through a friend, and this will be his first loan. He proposes to expand his business by buying more stock for his small bakery. This will enable him to meet the high demand and reach more clients; hence, improving his family's living standards. His future plans are to convert his small bakery into a big company, able to bake bread and cakes for major events.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: Expansion of his cake business

loans.name: Evencia

texts.en:
Along with her 76-years-old husband, Evencia Valea, 75 years old lives in a beautiful and verdant municipality of Pandan in Antique province. The couple became self- supporting after all of their four children have their own family to manage. Instead of asking her children for financial support, Evencia joined ASHI in 2005 wanting to request for a loan which will be used for a business which she and her husband could do their share of managing. Evencia knew that her children are also financially incapable to sustain the needs of their own family. Therefore, not even a single cent of her loan was wasted for unnecessary things.  It was used for financing a vegetable and fish buy and sell businesses. These businesses enable the old couple have a regular meal which is three times daily for Filipino. 

Evencia is not aiming for a bigger amount of loan to apply though she is qualified. Considering her age, and health, she knows her capacity to run a business. Loan she is requesting now and in the future will be used to sustain her previous and present business. This opportunity brings joy to Evencia since this has not only enabled her to support her needs and her husband’s but this is also her means of exercise mentally and physically because she sells not just in one place but in a lot of different places which sometimes requires a lot of walking for a house to house selling.

loans.use: Will be used to increase the inventory fish for selling.

loans.name: Aqlema Group

texts.en:
Aqlema and Fajya want to take out a loan for their tailoring business. They would like to buy new sewing machines. Jamela is requesting a loan for a quilting business. Nahida wants to receive a loan for her brother’s car parts shop. Khatera wants to take out a loan for her husband who is a mechanic and wants to buy essential materials for his shop. Nabila wants to take out a loan her husband who has a taxi and wants to buy a new part for it.

This is the Aqlema Group and Jamela is the group leader. The six members of this group have requested a group loan of 60,000 afghanis.

loans.use: To expand a quilting business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana D. sells MSE and Natasha cosmetics. She is 58 years old and is still striving to earn a daily living. She is married to Rogelio D. and they are blessed with eleven children, six of whom are already married. 

Currently she is paying for the allowances, tuition fees, and projects of two of her children who are in high school. Susana wants these two children to finish their schooling because education is the only thing she can give to them. Therefore, Susana and her husband are striving hard to meet their family's needs, especially those of her two students. 

Susana can meet the needs of her children only with the help of her husband and her direct-sales business. But Susana still needs additional capital to buy additional products to sell. Thus, she has decided to borrow Php5,000 from KIVA lenders. She knows that her determination to improve her family's living conditions will lead her to success.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 28 years old and single without children. She is a hard-working woman. She hopes to get married very soon. She loves cooking and that is why she commercialized her cooking skill by owning a restaurant where she sells drinks and cooked foods. The demand for her cooked foods in her community are high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more chairs and tables for her customers and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, chairs and tables

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea C., 26 and her husband, Mr. Chhum Choeung, 31, were married in 2004 and have two daughters. All of them are still young. They are living in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Just two months ago, Sophea started a business selling food and coffee from her house.  Before this, she worked for a beauty salon. Her husband has been a construction worker in Phnom Penh for over 13 years.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business and to renovate the roof of her house.

loans.name: Flor De Amapola Group

texts.es:
Cristina Ilaya de 39 años teje y vende ropa para bebes ya que tiene un pequeño taller de tejido en su domicilio, Norma C. de 29 años costura faldas para mujeres, también en su domicilio, Mónica T. de 20 años costura bermudas en su domicilio, éstos son algunos ejemplos de los negocios que tienen las integrantes del grupo Flor de Amapola que a su vez pertenecen al Centro Focal Villa Adela. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la tela y lana para  elaborar mayor cantidad de productos que ofertar a sus clientes.
Además a ellas les agrada el servicio de salud que se encuentra en este Centro Focal ya que pueden hacer uso de este servicio no solamente en el día de reunión, sino otros días también llevar a sus hijos e hijas para que les realicen un control de peso y talla.
texts.en:
Cristina is 39 years old. She makes and sells baby clothes and has a small workshop in her home. Norma is 29 years old and makes women's skirts, also in her home. Monica is 20 years old and makes shorts in her home. These are some examples of the activities conducted by the members of the group "Flor de Ampola," which is part of the "Centro Focal Villa Adela." They need a loan to buy supplies such as cloth and yarn to make more products for their customers. They also appreciate the health services they receive from the "Centro Focal" and that they can use these services anytime and take their sons and daughters to help in controlling their weights.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and yarn

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang M. is 31 years old and she lives with her husband, Mr. Vireak Chet in Prey Buy village in Takeo province. They have five children.  Three of the children attend school; the others are too young to work or study. 

Mrs Yang M. is a farmer, but she does not now have enough money to buy rice seed. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed.  She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers to make her crop more productive. Her husband is a laborer, and makes a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, pesticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna F. is from the village of Owaon in Dapitan City. She is 46 years old, married, and has three school-age children. To earn a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, she operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members. Myrna has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2007, Myrna joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was better equipped to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Notably, Myrna recently repaid a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This prior loan was used to to purchase additional inventory for the store, as well as fertilizers for gardening activities. Myrna is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 14,900 PHP ($325), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to supplement her existing working capital. This loan would be the fourth loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC and her second loan via Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor by using the Grameen micro-lending model.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 50 year old married woman with 3 children. She has been working in the tailoring occupation for the past 30 years. She opened her tailoring shop in 2007 to help her children in the household because her husband cannot work anymore. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman; with the loan requested of $1,000, she will buy additional textiles and a mechanical sewing machine that will facilitate her work and augment the production.

loans.use: To buy additional textiles and a mechanical sewing machine.

loans.name: Darling Celeste

texts.es:
La señora Darling Celeste S. G., es madre de dos niños, uno en edad escolar, tiene un tramo de venta de carne de cerdo, pepena, frito y morongas, desde hace 14 años, ubicado en el sector de cerdo.
Comenzó su negocio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00 ahorrados, siempre ha vendido en el mercado pero antes solo le ayudaba a vender a su mamá, lleva cinco años de trabajar con nosotros en el cual ella nos ha manifestado que ha través de los financiamientos a  podido  mejorar su condición de vida, ya que compra mercaderia para el negocio y de esto ella le hace mejora.
Con esfuerzo de ella y el de su esposo  ambos luchan por salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling Celeste S. G. is a mother of 2 children, one is of school age. For over 14 years she has had a stall where she sells pork, bacon, fried pork, and blood sausage, located in the pig sector.
