Mrs. S. began her business with a capital of C$ 3,000.00 in savings, she has always sold her products in the market but before she only helped her mother. She has 5 years working with us where she has told us that through the loans, she has been able to improve her quality of life since she buys merchandize for her business and she uses it to her advantage.

With the efforts of herself and that of her husband, both work hard to get ahead with their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more pigs to cook.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making "juanes"

loans.name: Djoumai

texts.en:
Djoumai O. is 41 years old. She lives in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo and works in the nearby markets. She sells yams, beans, corn, and dried manioc and began this business in 2007. This will be her first loan with WAGES and she will use it to resupply her stock.

Mrs. O. plans on purchasing 3 sacks of beans, 3 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of dried manioc, and using the remainder of the loan to buy yams. She is married to a taxi driver and has three children.

loans.use: Purchase of yams, beans, corn, and dried manioc

loans.name: Simion K

texts.en:
Simion is a 54-year-old gentleman. He is married and blessed with three children who all go to school. With this fourth loan, Simion intends to purchase maize seeds, phosphate and beans to plant. He will also use it to pay for ploughing, planting and weeding expenses.

Besides farming, Simion also runs a pool table and a photocopy business that give him additional income. His plan for the future is to buy more land for farming, and to ensure that all his children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and phosphate, and pay for labour

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca G. is currently in the business of selling dresses, trousers, bedsheets, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock shoes and sandals to sell. Rebecca is 40 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a pharmacy. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a stock of shoes and sandals to sell

loans.name: Asminda

texts.es:
la señora Asminda A. G. tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres.
Asminda ayuda a sus padres con la alimentacion y otros gastos del hogar, Asminda se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, este negocio para ella es rentable ya que su negocio esta ubicado en una zona donde 
hay muchas personas que compran tortillas. este es un alimento que acompaña los tres tiempos de comida y en esta zona existen personas que si no tienen tortillas prefieren no comer.
el sueño de Asminda es tener una maquina para hacer tortillas y asi facilitarle la produccion y tener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Asminda Ávila Gutiérrez, 47, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents; she contributes towards her parents’ nutrition and other household expenses. She is a tortilla merchant, a profitable business because her shop is located in an area where there are a lot of people that buy tortillas. This is a food item that accompanies all three daily meals and there are people in this area that, if they don’t have tortillas, would prefer not to eat. Asminda’s dream is to have a tortilla making machine so that production will be easier and sales higher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime powder, water and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shepherd Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Friendly Emelia is a widow and the mother of two children between 6 and 12 years old. She is now 35 years old. She lives together with her children in a community near Berekum, where she also has her business. She is able to support herself and her children through food-selling. She operates a food stall and sells “fufu” and “banku”. 

Banku and fufu are very popular local dishes among the Akan communities in Ghana, prepared from cassava with plantains and maize respectively. Selling for the past 10 years, Emelia has made quite a number of repeat customers through good customer relations. She plans to invest the loan to purchase cassava, plantains, maize, fish, meat and other food ingredients in bulk to improve her food quality.

Emelia is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Shepherd', made up of five members. Her dreams include ensuring healthy living for her children and extending help to other family members.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Abasse

texts.en:
Abasse is a 54-year-old borrower from Lebanon. He is married and has two children. Abasse has been running a tire garage since 1985. He sells and repairs all type of tires. He says that he is very committed to his work and proud of his experience. 

For the fourth time, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase tires for his work. His previous loans allowed him to continually improve his work and purchase good quality products. He hopes to further expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino tiene 58 años de edad, es viudo y vive junto al menor de sus hijos en el caserío Tolón, una zona rural del distrito de Yonán – Tembladera, distrito de la sierra norte del país, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Contumaza, región Cajamarca, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era joven, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar diversos granos como maíz por ejemplo, durante todos estos años el ha dependido de esta actividad para poder sostener a su familia por lo que ha trabajado arduamente para poder sacarlos adelante.

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz y el espera obtener una buena producción para poder asegurar el mantenimiento de los suyos, para lograr su objetivo piensa adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas, para adquirirlos ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Florentino es una persona tranquila y responsable, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien muy trabajador. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Florentino, 58, is a widower. He lives with his youngest son in Tolón, a rural sector of Yonán – Tembladera district, a district in the country’s northern mountains. It is located in Contumaza province, Cajamarca region, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer since he was a young man. He has a field where he grows grains like corn, for example. All these years he has depended on this activity to support his family so he has always worked hard to provide for them. He has planted corn and he hopes to obtain a good crop yield to insure his loved ones’ wellbeing. To reach his goal he needs to buy fertilizers and pesticides so he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy them. Florentino is a levelheaded, responsible person. Folks who know him consider him to be very hard working. He has collaborated with Our Institution previously and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for corn crop maintenance.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan N. is 18 years-old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is unmarred and has no children. For the last year, Susan has had a hotel (small restaurant) business.         

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and stock food like rice for use at the hotel.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Susan hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees.  In the future, Susan hopes to go back to school. Susan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing her business.

Note to lenders:

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. Initially, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, particularly girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Later, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies such as rice.

loans.name: Belek Group

texts.en:
The “Belek” solidarity group was created on the 16th of June, 2010. It is made up of four persons from Belek village who have the same interests in animal breeding. In this village, cattle breeding is the main means of subsistence and maintenance of the family for many people. 

Gulkaky S. is the leader of the group. She is 55, married and has one son of school age. Gulkaky started her milk-selling business by purchasing a milch (dairy) cow. Today, this activity brings her about 2,500 Kyrgyzstan Soms (KGS) monthly.   

Gulkaky applies for a loan to buy one more milch (dairy) cow, which will allow her to increase the amount of milk for selling. With the revenues, Gulkaky plans to give a good education to her son. She also wishes to take her family on a good vacation some day.

Group members:

Roza M. is 49 years old, single and has one son, who is 8 years old. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for 15 years. Roza started her business with her initial investment of 3,000 KGS.  She plans to use this loan to purchase two bull calves for fattening and reselling.
 
Chinarkul C. is 28, divorced and has one son. Seven years ago, in order to meet the expenses of her small family, she started her business in cattle breeding. She milks cows and sells dairy products to loyal customers. Using this loan,  Chinarkul plans to buy two bull calves for fattening and reselling. 

Chingiz T. is the youngest member of the group. He is 22 years old and single. He works in a confectioner's shop and helps his parents with animal breeding. Chingiz began his own business in fattening cattle five years ago. He also wants to obtain a loan to buy two bull calves for further reselling.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene L. is from the village of Babahagon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Rene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Rene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann F., 45, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo F., a jeepney driver, and mother to four children. By the grace of God, Mary Ann has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send all of them all the way through college.

Mary Ann oversees operations of their jeepney** transportation business. They have both long (20-22 person capacity) and short (14-16 person capacity) jeepneys, all of which are meeting their daily capacity quota. Mary Ann’s husband also drives one of the jeepneys. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy eight new tires for the jeepneys. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Mary Ann dreams to be able to buy another jeepney soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

**Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn income, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy eight new tires for the jeepneys

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA ESPERANZA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higia ;  La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, La socia se dedica  a prestar servicio de llamadas a celulares y fijos de todo el país, ella recarga sus 4 telefonos celulares en las dos lineas de telefonía, entonces ella de forma ambulante se para en las esquinas de las plazas mas concurridas y con su mandil fosforecente presta el servicio de llamadas a todo el país; La socia solo estudio la secundaria y no pudo tener acceso a estudiar en la superior debido a que su economía no le permite. La socia a averiguado sobre la posibilidad de comprar una carreta mazamorrera, para poder vender mazamorra caliente en diferentes tipos y tamaños de recipientes a distintos precio para el alcance de todo el publico. ella ya tiene planeado cambiar de negocio y es la razón por la cual solicita el prestamo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una carreta para vender mazamoras.

Los otros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos venden comida, animales menores, verduras, gaseosas y cervezas, pollería,  restaurantes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Higia, 25, is a member of the “NUEVA ESPERANZA” (New Hope) communal bank located in Ollantaytambo district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and a son.  She provides cellular and land line phone services to the entire country.  She recharges her two cellular phones on two lines and then goes to corners of the most popular city squares wearing a phosphorescent apron and provides calls to the whole country.  

She only finished secondary school because her economic situation did not allow for higher education.  She has make inquiries concerning the purchase of a food cart to sell hot mazmorra (a corn based dessert) in various sizes and quantities and prices so that it can be accessible to a wide range of customers.  She plans to change businesses and this is why she needs a loan in order to buy the mazmorra food cart.

The other group members alternate their household chores with retail.  They sell food, small farm animals, vegetables, soft drinks, beer, chicken and some run restaurants.

She is grateful for the loan granted and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy a food cart.

loans.name: Roqiya Shabnam Group

texts.en:
Sakina D. A. is a member of Roqiya Shabnam's group. She is married with four children and lives in 13th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Her children are students and their education is very important to her.
.
Sakina has a tailoring business and she has been involved in this business more than seven years. She needs the loan to purchase a new sewing machine and other important items for her business. She is thankful that this effective process supports her work.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and other important items

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Hawa. She is married and has six children, ages 10, 15, 16, 20, 23 and 26. She also has two grandchildren living with her whom she helps rear.

In 1980, Hawa established her textile and shoe business. She began her business because she wanted to buy land and educate her children. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about $350 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy lace, cotton, assorted uniform material and shoes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $200.

In the future, Hawa plans to educate her children and build a house with her husband.  She plans to travel to a neighboring country, Guinea, and sell on a wholesale basis to other traders. Hawa thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for resale

loans.name: Fawe Girls Waterloo Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the FAWE Girls School. The school is located in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded five years ago by Dr. Christiana Thorpe to educate girls, especially war-affected children. Currently, the school is staffed with ten teachers and has an enrollment of 400 pupils.

These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to seek a loan of 12,700,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy furniture, others to buy housing materials, a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest their portion of the loan in a business.

Denka M. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone, Denka is married to a teacher, and the couple has two children. Denka is seeking a loan portion of 700,000 SLL from SMT and Kiva lenders in order to buy furniture for his newly-built house.

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly E. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns and operates a bakery. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from baking and selling a variety of staple products including bread and cakes in the local community.  Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Beverly joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of her baking equipment. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for the maintenance of baking equipment.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more fabrics to expand her business. By doing so, she will be able to generate a better income. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

S. is a tailor, earning an income of $3 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. The family has to spend $80 on food, $15 on electricity supply, and $15 on other necessary expenses every month. 

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to expand the current business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a resident of Nyamira town in Western Kenya.  He has been practicing mixed farming, concentrating mostly on tea, for over ten years. He is married and has six children. He sells his tea products to the local market.

Fred has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He reckons that the dairy cow will enable him to generate enough income to pay school fees for this children. He is focusing on buying three more dairy cows to improve on his milk production in the next 5 years. He also intends to purchase a motor vehicle in the future to help transport his produce to the market.

Fred sees unpredictable weather conditions – especially heavy rains and droughts, coupled with the lack of farm supplies like fertilizer, as the major challenges in this business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en: Wilkister A. M. is forty two years old, married and has six children aged between 15 and 29 years old. Her business is located at Ngumo estate in Nairobi near a busy road. She sells handbags and vitenge (traditional shawls used as clothing). She has been in this business for the past fifteen years and sells to passersby and also to some loyal customers. She says that this business is profitable and that her major challenge is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more handbags and vitenges to expand her business and meet customer demand. She hopes to open a stall in the future. She describes herself as caring, determined and patient.

loans.use: to buy stock of handbags and vitenges

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance D. M. is a 36-year old lady. She is married to Mohamed, and they have four children.  Constance sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for the last year. 

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after paying the previous loan well and in good time.  She plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase onions,  raw maize, potatoes and bananas to add to the stock for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase onions, maize, potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Madame Julienne F. est une femme de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'01 enfant en charge. Elle a aussi la garde d'un de ses petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAINTE ANNE2 de puis le 14 juin 2002. Elle est également membre du comité de gestion dans lequel elle occupe le poste de présidente en remplacement de l'ancienne qui a rendu sa démission pour raison de maladie

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels, du lait, des biscuits, de l'huile végétale, du pain etc. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne dans le Banc Villageois et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Julienne F. is 60 years old, married and the mother of one dependent child. She also takes care of one of her grandchildren. 

She has been a member of the Sainte Anne2 Banc Villageois since June 14 2002. Currently president of the Banc Villageois, she replaced the former president, who resigned. 

Mrs. F. has a store where she sells various products such as milk, cookies, vegetable oil, bread, etc. Her new loan will allow her to increase her supply of merchandise. Her goal is to increase her savings at the Banc Villageois and to help her husband in meeting the family's needs.

loans.use: To stock her store with food products

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet K. is 27 years old, married, has one child and lives the town of Ibanda. She and her husband make a living by selling bananas, some of which she grows herself. She earns 220,000 shillings a month as profit, some of which comes from a beauty parlor she has run on the side for the last eight years. She is a God-fearing woman, and has applied for this loan to pay her child's school fees and buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees and buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nuvia Liceth

texts.es:
la sra. Nuvia Liceth M. P. tiene 35 años de edad, vive  en Ojo de Agua el Paraiso y se dedica a la venta de granos basicos como ser arroz, frijoles y maiz, tiene mucha experiencia en la venta de su producto  y en la administración de su negocio,
Doña Nubia abástese de estos granos a varios comedores de esa zona, su esposo les entrega el producto en sus negocios y esto hace que varias personas la prefieran ya que no tienen que movilizarse a comprar dicho producto.
Doña Nubia de su esposo recibe mucho apoyo en su negocio, juntos trabajan duro para salir adelante.
Nubia en la actualidad esta a cargo de su madre, como toda buena hija se ha tomado esa responsabilidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de arroz, frijoles y maiz.
texts.en:
Nuvia Liceth M. P. is 35 years old and lives in Ojo de Agua, El Paraíso.  Her business is selling basic grains such as rice, beans and corn.  She has a lot of experience selling her products and managing her business. 

Nubia supplies a number of eateries in the area with her produce.  Her husband makes deliveries to the businesses and some customers prefer buying from them because it means they don't have to travel to buy their produce.  Nubia receives a lot of support from her husband.  She and her husband work hard together in order to get ahead in life.

Nubia currently looks after her mother.  Like all good daughters, she has taken on this responsibility.  She will use her loan to buy rice, beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy basic grains: rice, beans and corn

loans.name: 4 Đông Hải Group

texts.en: Toán Lê Thị (263) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Toán is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 4 Đông Hải (16.5.4 Đông Hải ). Toán is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Toán raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Toán has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities. In 2011, Toán joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Toán is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The new loan of 4.248.000 VND will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Toán plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Thanh (259) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to raise livestock. 2. N. Thị Hiền (260) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to raise livestock. 3. N. Thị Lơn (262) is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to raise livestock. 4. Lê Thị Lưu (264) is a 61-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to raise crops. 5. Lê Thị Huyền (261) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to raise livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Toán Lê Thị (263) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Toán là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 4 Đông Hải (16.5.4 Đông Hải ). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Toán thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Toán kiếm được khoảng 500.000 VND. Vào 2011, Toán đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Toán đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Thanh (259) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Hiền (260) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. Thị Lơn (262) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Lê Thị Lưu (264) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. 5. Lê Thị Huyền (261) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mayra Sulema

texts.es:
La Sra. Mayra Sulema C. es comerciante individual, cuenta con un negocio que opera bajo el nombre de  Lácteos Los Tres Hermanos, Mayra cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio y esta ubicado en una zona estratégica de mayor comercio en el municipio de El Paraíso, lo que le permite el fácil acceso a sus clientes generándole mayor demanda en sus ventas.
La sra. Mayra utilizara el credito para comprar abarroteria y asi surtir mas su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
su meta es darles un buen estudio a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Mayra Sulema C. is a woman who runs a business that is called Lácteos Los Tres Hermanos. Mayra has over 5 years of experience managing the business, which is strategically located in a commercial area of El Paraíso, allowing her easy access to customers, thus generating better sales.

Ms. Mayra will use this loan in order to purchase provisions, thus restocking her business so that she can meet customer demand.

Her goal is to give her children a solid education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, light bulbs, candles, lard, cooking oil, margarine, bread, cookies, beverages, churros, eggs, soap, soups, pasta, salsa, juice, and milk.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a retail business since the beginning of 2008.  From the front of her house, she sells different kinds of merchandise to her neighbors and passing travelers.  She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, costume jewelry, cooking ingredients, fast food, plastic products, soft drinks, and other miscellaneous products.  Her husband is a chicken breeder. They have one child who works as a car repairer in a local garage. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Heng will be using the loan she requested to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina, a 24-year-old mother of one child, is married to a businessman. For the past two years Amina has run a salon in Likoni, and this will mark her second loan from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy nail polish, hair products and blow dry equipment for her salon. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business as she dreams of one day owning a chain of salons.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, hair products and blow dryers.

loans.name: Patung 2 Group

texts.en:
Manti, the group leader of Patung 2, is 32 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She has sold sculptures around the traditional market since 2009. The other group members, Rohana, Anita and Umi also sell sculptures, which is why their group name is Patung(sculpture) 2.

Manti's problem is that she doesn't have her own kiosk; that's why she needs to go around the traditional market every day. She hopes she can save her money and open her own kiosk in a strategic place to invite more buyers.

Now, her daily income is used to fulfill the family's daily need and also to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sculptures

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Eufemia has a retail shop that sells food supplement products from DXN. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to sell medicinal or food supplement products from DXN.

Eufemia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eufemia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to sell medicinal or food supplement products from DXN

loans.name: Wassilatou

texts.fr:
Wassilatou est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée à un entrepreneur. Elle a deux enfants.

Elle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des cartes de recharges puis des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé puis revend à domicile à Agoé.
Elle  a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter plus de cartes de recharges  et de produits d’alimentation.
texts.en:
Wassilatou is 34 years old. She is married to an entrepreneur. She has two children.

She has been working as a retailer since 2002. She sells prepaid cards and groceries. She gets her supplies from the Grand Market in Lome and resells at home in Agoe.

She requested her first loan from WAGES to buy more prepaid cards and groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries and prepaid phone cards.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is 40 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been selling clothes for 20 years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  

She plans to buy more clothes to sell in her clothes shop. She wants to concentrate more on children's clothing.

In the future, she hopes to own a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Vicente Baudilio

texts.es: El Sr. Vicente y su esposa Ronmy llevan muchos años de vivir juntos. Ellos residen en la localidad de Cotoca en la casa de la madre del señor Vicente. Tienen dos hijos. Don Vicente trabaja como taxista en Santa Cruz con su movilidad y su esposa administra el servicio de amplificación. El crédito solicitado es para comprar nuevos parlantes por que los que tiene ahora se encuentran deteriorados. Esta muy agradecido por que emprender le esta dando la oportunidad de renovar su equipo de amplificación y de esta manera generar mas ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente and his wife Ronmy have lived together for many years.  They live in the town of Cotoca, in Vicente's mother's house, and have two children.  Vicente works as a taxi driver in Santa Cruz.  His wife manages their sound system service.

Vicente is requesting this loan to buy new speakers as the ones that he has now are in a bad state of repair.  He is very grateful that Emprender are giving him the opportunity to renew his sound system equipment so that he can make more income and improve his whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new speakers

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
In 2004, Juan moved to the United States from Peru. He was hired by a prominent courier company and was able to learn more about the business while maintaining strong relationships with couriers locally and around South America. By the end of 2009, Juan started his own business selling small containers of electronics to countries such as Colombia and Bolivia, as well as shipping agricultural equipment to Chile and Peru. Juan’s business began to take off as he continued requesting wholesale prices from his main distributors in order to successfully send products to his clients. The business’ profit depends on whether the product is discontinued or refurbished.

Juan will use the loan as working capital in order to buy wholesale merchandise to send to his clients in South America. The loan will give him flexibility and independence as he provides a quote for his new and existing clients.

loans.use: To buy wholesale merchandise to sell to clients.

loans.name: Madjiguene

texts.fr: Commercante, mariée et mère de famille, elle fait dans la broderie de boubous locals avec assie une mercerie qu'elle gére. Ce crédit lui permettra l'achat de nouveaux marcandises pour le bon fonctionnement de sa commerce et d'accroitre son fond de roulement afin de rendre plus fructueux ses activités. Situé dans une ville enclave de la capitale Sénégalaise cette commercante s'active depuis plus de 5 ans dans ce domaines et veut en faire une particularitée pour avoir des moyens afin de faire des voyages a l'étrangé pour acheter des marchandises
texts.en: Madjiguene is married and a mother. She is also a retailer; she embroiders Boubous - colourful West African Kaftans - and runs a haberdashery. This loan will be used to restock her store and increase her working capital, so that she can invest in her business and make it more profitable. Madjiguene has been running her business in a town near the Senegalese capital for over 5 years and wants specialize so that she can earn more and is able to travel overseas and buy stock.

loans.use: to restock on sewing notions for her haberdashery and the items she needs to make traditional Boubous

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 57 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are employed as professionals. She earns a living by running a general store and by making dresses and providing tailoring services. She has been in this line of work for almost 10 years, thanks in part to the fact that her husband manages her store when she is busy making dresses. She is applying for a loan for PHP 35,000 to buy more groceries to sell in her store, where sales have been very high lately because it is located along a busy road. She will use the loan to buy canned goods, eggs, oil, soft drinks, milk, sugar, shampoo, instant noodles and ingredients needed for cooking. She hopes that his loan will allow her to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy buy items to sell in a general store.

loans.name: Rose Awino

texts.en: Rose is a 26-year-old married woman. She has a child. She describes herself as transparent. She operates a cereals sales business where she sells maize, millet, sorghum, soya and groundnuts. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a shopping centre in Kisumu. She describes her biggest business challenge as fire outbreaks. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to add stock of cereals. Her business goal is to grow it to a wholesale operation within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will become a renowned business lady in Kisumu.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals

loans.name: Awovi

texts.fr:
Awovi est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire.  
Awovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle achète et revend des pagnes, des tissus et des mèches à toutes les personnes à la devanture de leur maison au quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule sur son activité. 
Awovi a requis son premier crédit WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes de qualité, des tissus de qualité et les nouvelles arrivages de mèches.
Dans les prochaines années, Awovi voudrait acquérir sa propre boutique de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une vie heureuse.
texts.en:
Awovi is 29 years old and single. She has been working since 2003 buying and reselling lengths of African print cloth, other fabrics, and hair extensions to all comers in front of their house in the Adidogomé district of Lomé. She buys her wares in the Grand Marché in Lomé. She works by herself in the business. 
 
Awovi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy high-quality "pagnes" and other high-quality fabrics and recently imported hair extensions. In the coming years, Awavi would like to acquire her own little shop. She says that with the profit, she intends to live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth, other fabrics, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Affossogbe Group

texts.fr: AFFOSSOGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Blandine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un enseignant nommé Romane. Le couple a un enfant, qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Blandine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Blandine a arrêté l’école au cours primaire, mais a appris la couture, activité qu’elle exerce depuis six ans environs et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité, Blandine vend des produits divers (savons, produits de beauté) dans son quartier. Blandine achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Blandine et les autres membres du groupe AFFOSSOGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: AFFOSSOGBE is a group of four people who all live in the same district.  The representative of the group, Blandine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 24 years old and is married to a teacher named Romane. The couple has one child in their care who attends school.  Blandine lives with her husband and child.  Together, the couple meets the different needs of the household.  Blandine stopped attending school at the primary level, but she learned to sew.   She has been in this line of work for about six years and this brings her a considerable income.  Along with this work, Blandine sells various products (soaps, beauty products) in her area.  Blandine buys her products in Bénin.  This is the second time that Blandine and the other members of the AFFOSSOGBE group have requested a loan through ALIDé.  Their goal is to increase their working capital and the level of their work and to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and beauty products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 39-year-old married woman but has no children. She has had a business of selling food items in Yei, South Sudan, for nine years. 

Florence requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase soda, salt, and sugar for sale. She says that she will use her extra income from this loan to build a department store for her business extension in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda, salt, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai is a 59-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Khai and her husband have been running a general store for 20 years. She would like to request a loan to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, biscuits, jam, and tea to stock in her store. She hopes that the loan will enable her to generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, biscuits, jam, and tea for her store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de una de las miembros quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona. El comité se denomina “Virgen del Rosario”, están en el Noveno Ciclo y está constituido por 11  integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor. 
Una de las miembros es la señor a Alicia, quien gracias a su trabajo y lucha diaria ha podido ayudar a su familia y sacarlos adelante. Ella tiene una peluquería en la que diariamente trabaja, atendiendo a mucha cantidad de clientes. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y muy luchadora. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuague, tintes, esmaltes para uñas y demás insumos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
This group formed when one of the members contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in the area.  The group is called "Virgen del Rosario" and they are in their ninth loan cycle.  There are 11 members of the group.  The group is known in their neighborhood for being very united and responsible.  The members have a strong entrepreneurial spirit.  

One of the members is Alicia, who thanks to her work and daily struggle has been able to help her family and get them ahead.  She has a beauty salon where she works every day, seeing a large number of customers.  She describes herself as a hardworking and enterprising fighter. 

She is asking for this loan to purchase shampoo, conditioner, hair dyes, nail polish, and other items to stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, conditioner, hair dye, nail polish, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu lives in Likoni, Kenya. She owns a video show room which has been in operation for two years. She started the business out of her household savings. After being introduced to Milango by her friends, Mwanamkuu is now applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy more video cassettes for showing and for sale. 
Her ambition for the future is to open other video show rooms and also to have a video library. The main challenge is the seasonality of the business. Since Coast Province where Likoni lives is a tourist area, when the season is low, she also makes fewer sales.
Mwanamkuu will use the extra income obtained from the loan to renovate the show room to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy more video cassettes for show and for sale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a determined and kind person. She is 33 years old. She is married and has two children in school. She and her husband work together to earn a living. Mary Jane runs her clothing shop, while her husband is a vendor of fruits in the public market of Santiago City. Mary Jane has been in this kind of business for 12 years, and she earns about 10,000 PHP a month, which she uses to pay for their daily needs, her children's expenses, and the family's monthly electric bill.

Mary Jane would like financial assistance amounting to 15,000 PHP to buy different kinds of ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing shop. She is hoping that she can obtain a larger profit to better support her children in their daily needs and to provide for their education.

In the future, Mary Jane is expecting that she can continue to improve her clothing shop business and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing shop.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su madre en casa familiar ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas el negocio lo aprendió debido a la necesidad económica todos los días vende de lunes a domingo.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar la materia prima como: maíz y leña, de esa forma podrá tener lo necesario para mejorar su negocio y tener más clientes el cual podrá incrementar sus ganancias.
El objetivo de Blanca es  siempre mantener estable su negocio y de esa forma podrá darle lo necesario a su madre y tener mejor vida.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her mother in the family home and works selling tortillas, a job she learned to do because of economic necessity. She sells every day, Monday to Sunday. 

She needs a loan to buy basic supplies such as corn and firewood. In this way, she will be able to have what she needs to improve her business and attract more customers so that she can increase her income.

Blanca’s goal is to maintain a steady business so that she will be able to meet her mother’s needs and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Rebeca tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Sicuani de la provincia de Canchis departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad de Calca. Su actividad económica principal de Rebeca es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, fideos, aceites, conservas, papel higiénico y muchas cosas más. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Rebeca requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
The Andrés Avelino Cáceres communal bank is made up of hardworking and responsible people who strive to get their families ahead.  Most of the members live in Cusco where they work.  Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial area, famous for its Inti Raymi festival and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu, is found there.

Rebeca, 34, is in a common-law marriage and they have two children.  She was born in Sicuani district of Canchis province, Cusco department but she lives in the beautiful city of Calca.  Her main work is selling staples items such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, pasta, oil, conserves, toilet paper and more.  She has been in this business for two years and it’s going very well.  At this time Rebeca needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, and more

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is 39 years old, a married woman who has been blessed with two single children, living in Ang Snoul district. She works in a garment factory as sewing staff and she normally gets her payment monthly. She works from Monday to Saturday and her time schedule is from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.
 
On the other hand, her husband sells soft drinks, syrup, pure drinking water, and coffee from his motorcycle with a trailer at the side. 

Mrs. Sam would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy stocks of coffee from a neighboring country, Vietnam, to sustain her husband’s business and constant sales. As a future goal, Mrs. Sam hopes to own a coffee shop in her commune and serve drinks.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coffee to sustain her husband’s business and constant sales.

loans.name: Isabelito

texts.en:
Isabelito is a 52-year-old married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in retail sales of firewood, charcoal and others. He also raises pigs.

Isabelito is asking for a loan to buy more coconut shells, charcoal, and feed for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells, charcoal, and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Dina la socia tiene 32 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,pefumes,colonias entre otros, la socia vende sus productos a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de joyas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Patron de San Jeronimo." This bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Dina. She s 32 years old. She has two children and is married. She divides her time between her daily chores and her business of selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, and colognes, among other items. She sells her products to all the customers who request them. She has been working in this business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is applying for a loan to purchase women's perfumes.

The member whose photo is attached asked permission to arrive late at the meeting for work reasons.

The other members work in businesses of selling jewelry, clothing, groceries, and beauty products.

Señora Dina is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy women's perfumes.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer from Magajin Aska village. As a Babban Gona member, Usman is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Usman can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Usman no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Usman hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eliana Ysabel

texts.es:
Eliana con 39 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar,junto a sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos como son piqueos,chicha,parihuela,ceviche,arroz con pato,caldos entre otros. Adicionalmente se dedica por las mañanas al servicio de limpieza. Solicita préstamo para la compra de activo fijo, como sillas, mesas,etc, para mejorar su atención al público y otros gastos.

Eliana es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para la compra de activo fijo, como sillas, mesas,etc.

loans.name: Mawulawoè

texts.en:
With an educational level of class CM2, Mr Mawulawoè E. was born in 1967 at Dangbessito in the district of Sanguéra. He is a monogamous father of four children, with one other dependent child. His main occupation is raising pigs, and he wishes to improve this business with a loan of $1000. This money would allow him to obtain a better breed of pigs, and to buy veterinary services and food for the animals. His current and potential future clientele represents a major asset for the success and durability of his venture. The ideal fulfillment of this project will allow him to increase his income considerably, with a view to making improvements for his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, a Kiva volunteer.

Du niveau de la classe de CM2, Monsieur E. Mawulawoè est né en 1967 à Dangbessito dans le canton de Sanguéra. Il est monogame et père de quatre (04) enfants et a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il a pour activité principale l’élevage de porcs qu’il souhaite améliorer à travers un crédit de $1000. Ce fonds lui permettra de se procurer d’une race améliorée de porcs, de s’acheter un service vétérinaire et des provendes pour les bêtes. La clientèle actuelle et potentielle qu’il dispose est un atout majeur pour la bonne réussite et la pérennité de ses activités. La parfaite réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter sensiblement ses revenus en vue de l’amélioration acceptable de sa famille.

loans.use: to obtain a better breed of pigs, and to buy veterinary services and food for the animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her beading and weaving business

loans.name: Subkhonali

texts.en:
As a person living in countryside all his life, M. Subkhonali has more than 15 years of experience with cattle. He does not have college education. Subkhonali is married and has four children. His last job was at a motor transport depot, where he worked as a bus driver. Because of the low salary, he wanted to migrate to Russia for work, but because of son’s marriage he had to postpone the trip. Soon he learned about MicroInvest and after successfully using the first loan he decided to stay home.  
He plans to increase the number of cattle, which is very profitable and allows him to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase bulls for his cattle-breeding business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana decided to begin her small market business about six years ago after observing her friends who had their own businesses. She operates a little sales kiosk at the Angolenko market in Zaporoshye, Ukraine where she sells women’s clothing.

Sventlana decided to concentrate on selling inexpensive clothing. She has found a neat niche by marketing affordable clothing to older customers who frequently live on small fixed incomes.

Svetlana and her husband have two children. Her goal for her business is to be able to earn enough to support her family. Svetlana has requested a $600 loan to help her purchase more seasonal inventory. She has proven to be a great client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past and we are glad of this opportunity to further help her with her business.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of her women's clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify the products offered

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina has been married to Antonio for 27 years, and they have two children. Thanks to the values and the good examples instilled in them, they have become exemplary people that are their parents’ pride and joy. Ever since she started her family and up until just a little while ago, she dedicated herself to selling delicious cheeses that her highly valued in her city markets. Now, having saved enough money with this job, she decided to rent a space and open a poultry restaurant with the support of her loving husband and wonderful children. To finish opening her poultry business, she needs a loan that she will invest in buying tables and chairs. She promises to repay the loan in no more than her seven months. Guillermina and her lovely family await your selfless support to meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina está casada desde hace 27 años con Antonio y tienen dos hijos quienes gracias al buen ejemplo y valores que inculcaron en ellos ahora se han convertido en personas ejemplares que los llenan de satisfacción y mucho orgullo.Ella desde que formó su familia y hasta hace poco siempre se dedicó a la comercialización de quesos muy sabrosos y bien cotizados en los mercados de su ciudad; ahora después de haber ahorrado lo suficiente con este trabajo decidió alquilar un local y abrir una pollería; con apoyo de su fiel esposo y sus ejemplares hijos y para terminar de implementar su pollería solicita un préstamo que invertirá para adquirir mesas y sillas con el compromiso de reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso no mayor de los siete meses.“Guillermina y su encantadora familia esperan tu apoyo desinteresado para cumplir con sus objetivos”.

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs to open a new restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To further improve the image of her business and to provide better service for her clients

loans.name: Zuhrajon

texts.en: J. Zuhrajon lives in Spitamen and she is married and has 4 children. Mrs. J. Zuhrajon applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended herself as a serious and executive client. Mrs. J. Zuhrajon is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge. She has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she helped firstly her mother on the farm and now she helps her husband. It is the family business that brings the general income. Now she works in the hotel “Orom,” too, but most of the time she is engaged in the family business. She is engaged in milk production and its work out. In time she dreams of purchasing a pedigree milk-cow for the milk-sour products making. Now Mrs. J. Zuhrajon requests a loan of $375 for the milk-cow purchasing.

loans.use: milk-cow purchase

loans.name: Witness's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Witness S., age 36, is single and owns a small general store, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 5 PM daily, she earns about $65 a month from this business.

In the past, Witness successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy inventory for her business. She now hopes for a loan to once again purchase shop inventory. Witness belongs to a loan group called Upendo and will be sharing this loan with group members Easther H., Rhoda S., and Frida A.. These women have businesses dealing in hardware, clothing, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy shop inventory

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba B. is 57 years old. She and her husband have raised four children.

Mahbuba and her family have run a business for 10 years already. Mahbuba bakes the national bread called “lepeshka.” She has her own bakery shop. Mahbuba is well-known in her neighborhood as a hard-working woman. Everyday, she bakes up to 500 “lepeshka.” The prepared products are sold from her bakery as well as in the local market. The business is successful and generates a stable income for her family.

Today, Mahbuba needs to purchase materials for her business, like the flour and fuel that are required for the operations of her business. For this purpose, she requests 950.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Mahbuba is a repeat client for IMON and has a positive credit history. She wants to thank everyone for supporting her today and promises to be accurate in her loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour and fuel required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 63 year old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. She has a grocery shop and is also a tailor. She needs a loan to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
A. Betty Florence owns a cosmetic shop and also sells clothing. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for additional capital to buy more cosmetics and clothing for sale.

loans.use: This loan will be used as additional capital to buy more cosmetics and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mayoro

texts.fr:
Mr. F. is a young businessman who manages a spare parts shop at the bus station in Thies. He is from the Medina Falls neighborhood in Thies. He is married and has one child. He has been a loyal client of the loan association since 2004. In order to increase his income, he is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of spare parts.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr F. est un jeune commerçant qui gère un magasin de pièces détachées à la gare routière de THIES. Il est originaire du quartier MEDINA FALLS de THIES. Il est marié et père d'un enfant. C'est un fidèle client de la mutuelle depuis l'an 2004. C'est dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus qu'il contracte des prets pour acheter des quantités importantes de pièces détachées.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare parts

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana dedicates herself to raising cows, from which she then sells the milk at the PIL Andina milk plant.

She lives in the Huancollo community in the Tihuanacu section, about three hours from the city of La Paz.

She lives with her husband who works as an employee in the mayor’s office of the region. She has four children, ages 11, 10, 8 and 6, respectively.

The loan would be used to purchase a milk cow of better quality so she can increase her milk production, therefore her sales and income.

This is her first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Valeriana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive., vive en la comunidad Huancollo del sector de Tihuanacu provincia Ingavi a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como empleado en la alcaldía del sector, tiene 4 hijos de 11,10,8,6 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow to increase her production and therefore her sales.

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna Kanwal Baji is the wife of R. M. Anwar and lives in an area named Yadgar (a famous historical place) in Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her elder son works in a spare parts shop. The next eldest is an employee in a newspaper company named “Inkilab”. Her younger sons are enrolled in a school and are in 5th standard (level). Her first two daughters completed 12th grade. Her younger daughter is in 6th standard.

Hussna Baji is a housewife but she sews clothes and earns a profit. Her husband, R. M.Anwar, is a newspaper seller. He buys newspapers from a newspaper market and distributes them to various places. He has been in this profession for the last 10 years.

Husna Baji successfully completed three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and expanded her husband’s business. Now she is applying for a loan for the same purpose (to purchase more newspapers).

loans.use: To buy more newspapers

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica tends a newspaper stand that is on the corner of her house for 20 years now.

In addition, Angelica has divided her house into small commercial spaces to be able to rent them out. She has also built several rooms in her second floor, which she rents out. She has been working in this way for 20 years.

The loans she has received have been used to maintain the rooms she rents out.

Angelica would like to build a mini-apartment in her home to be able to rent it out and help her son in his business of motorcycle spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica atiende un quiosco de periódicos que está en la esquina de su casa desde hace 20 años.

Asimismo, Angélica ha dividido su casa en pequeños locales para poder alquilarlos. También ha construido vaR. cuartos en su segundo piso, los cuales son rentados. Ya tiene 20 años trabajando de esta manera.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para el mantenimiento de los cuartos que alquila.

Angélica quisiera construir un minidepartamento en su casa para poder alquilarlo, y ayudar a su hijo en su negocio de venta de repuestos motociclísticos.

loans.use: to maintain the rooms she rents out  (Para el mantenimiento de los cuartos que alquila.)

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy P. is 57 years old and married with six children. She has many years of experience in the grocery business. She sells her groceries in her village and to the public six days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD).

Daisy has benefited from five previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. SPBD loans are Daisy’s only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her business and to help financially support her family. Her husband also helps out with her grocery sales.

loans.use: To purchase items to improve her grocery sales and business status, and to help financially support her family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 38 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 13 años llamado Susanny. Se dedica a la atención de su pequeño quiosco, donde ofrece bebidas, golosinas, galletas, etc, desde hace ya 19 años, ahora que su hija Susanny tiene 13 años, la ayuda mucho en la atención del quiosco, en sus ratos libres, y así juntas, trabajan para sacar el negocio adelante.  A Victoria le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede educar a su hija, realizándolo con mucha alegría, siendo lo más difícil, el no poder pasar todo el tiempo que a ella le gustaría junto a su hija. Victoria se esfuerza mucho para brindarle a su Susanny un futuro promisorio con muchas oportunidades. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más mercadería para la abastecer su quiosco.  En el futuro Victoria se ve con una gran tienda de abarrotes, que atenderá en la comodidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old and a single mother of a 13 year old girl named Susanny. For the past 19 years, she has made a living by running a small kiosk where she offers drinks, candies, cookies, etc. Now that Susanny is 13 years old, she helps a lot with the kiosk in her free time and together, they work to move the business forward. Victoria likes her job because she can educate her daughter, which she does with great pleasure. The most difficult part is she cannot spend all of her time with her daughter. Victoria puts a lot of effort into providing a promising future with many opportunities for Susanny. With this loan, she will buy more merchandise to supply her kiosk. In the future, Victoria would like a big market of groceries that she could run out of the comfort of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her kiosk

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo, sus hijos y sus padres. Desde niña, con sus padres, ha realizado la actividad de la agricultura, ahora que tiene pequeños niños siente dificultad en hacerlo, su esposo trabaja fuera en una mina, por ello no siembra grandes cantidades como a ella le gustaría, pero de todos modos, así con sus pequeños bajo su responsabilidad, está sembrando con ayuda de sus familiares. Para ella le es muy rentable la agricultura, ha visto por conveniente sembrar papa en mayor cantidad, ya que también siembra olluco, aunque a veces el hielo lo quema y pierde, pero no todas las veces. Lo difícil para ella es que sus hijos están muy pequeños y esto dificulta su trabajo. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y ha sido puntual en el  pago todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero va comprar guano de corral y fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacra.
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 years old, is married and has 3 children. She lives with her husband, her children and her parents. Since she was a child she carried out the activity of agriculture with her parents and now that she has small children she feels difficulty doing it. Her husband works away in a mine which is why she does not grow as large of quantities as she would like, but in any case with her little ones as her responsibility, she is growing with the help of her relatives. For her agriculture is very profitable and she has seen it to be convenient to grow potatoes in greater quantities as she also grows "olluco", although sometimes the ice burns it and it is lost, but not always. The difficult thing for her is that her children are very small and this complicates her work. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she has been punctual with the payment of all of her installments. With the money she is going to buy farm manure and chemical fertilizers to fertilize her field.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. sells food items like fresh tomatoes and pepper, onions, and others at Iture near Elmina. Elizabeth has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children; her husband is a mason. Elizabeth has been selling food items since 2007. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy additional capital for more food for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy as an additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un C., is 40, married with two children, and lives with her husband in Phrey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their rice paddy growing rice for their annual supplies. Besides growing crops, the couple also operate another business performing classical and traditional music. When there is a celebration, a wedding party or ceremony in the community, the person in charge of the celebration will hire them to play the music.
